Reviews.Title: “Good location but just average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harish Velji
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just prior to the Christmas. Location is good but room quality is poor. There is hardly any room to move. We requested staff on number of occasions to arrange taxis which never happened. However they arranged prepaid taxi to airport. I suppose they must have been happy to get rid of us. As our flight was in the evening we requested the use of one room for an hour or so extra but was denied. Breakfast is ok. I suppose that for Singapore the room price is average but hotel generally is below average and nothing inspiring.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wannabeaussie
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore on a stop over on our way to Australia. This hotel is in an excellent location and lots of places (Raffkes etc) are all within easy walking distance. The staff were very helpful. This was very obvious when my husband lleft his camera in a taxi. The staff contacted the taxi company to check with the driver if the camera was still in the cab, Unfortunatley not,but mothing was too much trouble for the staff at this very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location average rooms”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: I decided to the Bay viiew hotel. I saw it across the street from the Rendezvous. It's in the same good location close to MRt Circle line stations. walking distance to Bugis Junction, Iluma, Raffles City and a few steps away from a good Kopitiam. Breakfast is average. Rooms need some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chloe D
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel again for my trip to Singapore on March this year and to my surprise i paid more reasonable rate than what i had paid during my previous stay. Only to know when i arrived to the hotel there is subway construction going on infront of the hotel. But as traveller, i didn't spend much time during daytime in the room so it didn't bother me much. Important thing is i had clean room in a good location with reasonable rate. It has good buffet breakfast and the hotel staff are friendly. The highlight of this hotel is nice rooftop garden with swimming pool. I would recommend this to those who are looking for hotel in good location with reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “BUYER BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: mykeyz
Reviews.Content: The Bayview Hotel is in an excellent location. However what they dont tell you is that at the time of making a booking there are huge construction works going on right outside of hotel. This also effects the surrounding hotels in Bencoolen street. There are 3 more years of this construction before it is complete!!. The noise is constant in the rooms from early morning until late at night. BUYER BEWARE......................... The Management were very rude, off-handed and argumentative when we voiced our concerns. Shame on you Bayview!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: Dirty, smelly and very noisy as well as very very rude management. No wifi as advertised, only on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls spoils overall value”
Reviews.Author: SLChong
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at Bayview Hotel, Bencoolen Street Singapore on a business trip. The hotel is very near Orchard Road and there is a 7 Eleven and food court literally steps away from the entrance, which is a great convenience. However, the sound proofing of the rooms is a problem and I could hear the guests next door to the extent that it disturbed my sleep for 3 of the 4 nights I stayed here. The sound seemed to be coming through the bathroom. The corridors also had a musty smell. The hotel is also surrounded by MRT construction work, which does generate a lot of sound during the daytime, although it does stop after 9.30pm. This didn't bother me as much, as I got back to the hotel later in the day. However, due to the construction, it is rather confusing for the taxis to find, so I had to guide the taxi driver on occassion to get to the entrance. Breakfast was decent, with the food on offer changed slightly everyday to break the monotony. Staff were generally helpful and courteous. For the price charged, with 2 single beds, coffee maker, iron & ironing board and breakfast, SGD 160 per night (exclusive 10% service charge and GST), seemed like a good deal. However, this was spoiled by the paper thin walls between rooms and heavy construction around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bayview Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sankar N
Reviews.Content: Hi, Had booked my hotel stay from India. The hotel is situated right in the middle of multiple MRT stations. From the Hotel entrance come on the main road then take a right and walk 5 mins is Dhoby Ghaut MRT(Interchange) which connects you to all MRT lines and to the left of the main road is Bras Barah MRT(Circle line). The Rooms are clean and the staff is very co-operative. The breakfast was not very good and the options kept everyday was minimum and some times repeated the same day. The swimming pool on the 15th floor doesn't have option for kids. The hotel only takes SGD 50 as a security deposit aganist any usage done by the guest, aganist an higher amount by other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TiSwede
Reviews.Content: Warning! Don't stay at this hotel. Construction work going on just by the hotel. After complaining, we did get a new room facing the other side but you can still hear the work going on far after 9 pm. The personnel were not very understanding when we asked about changing room but after a while they did admit that it was not very pleasant and that we could get another room (a twin room instead of a double that we had booked and much more worn out than the first room we had). The receptionists were not very helpful and our first impression was not at all good. We also had problems with the baby cot that we had booked for our daughter. When we changed room no-one came to help us. We had to move our entire luggage and the baby cot ourselves. The rooms are quite old and worn out. The swimming pool is quite nice. Not at all huge but ok. Breakfast buffet will feed you but quite uninteresting. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but be aware....”
Reviews.Author: Michieltravel
Reviews.Content: Be aware that there is construction going on on the road right before the hotel. This will take a few months. A lot of loud noise you can hear where ever you are in the hotel. The hotel does not warn you for this and does not give you a discount for this. They moved us to a room at the back of the hotel but did not make a difference. Construction starts at 0800 and continues to 2100! Staff is not the best. Rooms are older than they look on internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the buck”
Reviews.Author: jtblin
Reviews.Content: Good location within 10 minutes of the MRT station (although there is some construction work in the street at the moment, making it a bit difficult to access by taxi) between Orchard Rd and Clarke Quay, room was not huge but spacious enough for the price allowing to work comfortably at the desk, service is just ok. Other than that it isn't very pretty but the main point is really the value: cheap, free breakfast (average quality with western and asian food), free internet, swimming pool on the roof. The fitness room is a joke on the other hand: tiny room smelling mold with only a treadmill and a machine that I didn't even try given the smell. There is a park nearby (Fort Canning Park) if you are into running and the roof is a nice place for working out at dawn. When most (much more expensive) hotels in Singapore will charge you $20-40/day for internet access, having free internet is really a plus. There is also free wifi in the lobby and restaurant. Definitely not a place that I'd recommend for a romantic holiday but it does the trick very well when you travel on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: VirmaniKartik
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Singapore and this is the place I got to stay on doing my booking from RCI. Everything about this hotel was good. The location is just perfect with 2 MRT stations in the vicinity(100 meters and 300 meters). There is a new MRT station being built right in front of the Hotel Entrance and will be completed by this year end. There is a nice Seven Eleven outlet also located just next to the Hotel, where travelers can shop for any of their daily needs. They offered a good comfortable room. All tour packages were booked with ease by the hotel staff. Being pure Vegetarians we had fewer options for Food both for Breakfast and Lunch/Dinner. Although the staff was courteous enough to make a few vegetarian dishes for us on request.

Reviews.Title: “Good value suite in a reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: mrdeeping
Reviews.Content: was the end of a two and half week holiday in Vietnam and Singapore and we wanted something more than a cramped room. We paid 250 USD a night for a suite. The rooms were of good sizes. The bedroom was en-suite and there was another toilet attached to the living room. A first for us. We would not normally pay this much, but it seemed good value compared to some of the basic rates that were being charged for just a bedroom. The staff were very helpful, one guy spending a lot of time trying to explain how we could get to some of the greener areas of Singapore. The breakfasts were reasonable with a decent number of options. There's a 24 hr 7/11 and a small but varied food-court next to the hotel. There's a bus stop and metro station very close. The one thing that could be a problem is the construction work outside the hotel. This is related to the metro and we were told was due to continue for a few years. It had no impact on us whist we were there. They even put Xmas decorations all round the shuttering.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel that's very near the MRT!”
Reviews.Author: jovanpuyo
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Bayview last time, and so on my next trip to Singapore (this time to watch the Wicked musical at Marina Bay Sands) I booked the hotel again. There are a number of changes in this trip compared to my last one: 1. There is some construction work being done on Bencoolen street itself. I didn't know this until the taxi cab turned left to Bencoolen coming from Middle Road. It's not that big of a hassle but it's noisy during daytime and the taxi stand right in front of the hotel is gone temporarily. 2. The Bras Basah Circle Line Station is open! This is awesome! If walking two or three blocks to the Dhoby Ghaut station is a turnoff, now all you have to do is walk to the corner or Bras Basah and the MRT is entrance is there on your left. In this trip I was able to try the pool, and it was wonderful. I don't know if other guests use this, but I have it all to myself when I went up to the 15th floor. After almost two years, hardly anything changed in the buffet breakfast. If your package doesn't have this, consider yourself blessed. The selection is lousy. As alternatives, there's a 24-hour Kopitiam place a stone's throw away from the hotel that serves chicken rice, dimsum, laksa, duck rice and whole lot more. If that's not your fancy, walk a little more to the Wendy's Hamburgers right next to it along Bras Basah. Our room came with free WIRED internet. What's funny is you have to get the network cable from the lobby, where you have to sign some form saying that you'll return it when you check out. That wasn't my experience the first time I stayed in this hotel. A lot of people must be packing this along with their laptops. Talking about internet, it's slow, even by Philippine standards. I was hardly getting a 1 Mbps connection. I had aircon problems the first time I was here (it was dripping), and I encountered another aircon problem this time - it wasn't making the room cooler. I had to call the reception to have them fix it. Only after the maintenance guy cleaned the filter and made some adjustments did the aircon start to work properly. Will I come back? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Bayview Hotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Louieboytoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Very accomodating staff (they also speak Englsih), clean hotel, with swimming pool and very near shopping places! Though I have no plans of going to SG soon, but i can say that I made a good choice and will be in this hotel again if in case I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “view, what view?”
Reviews.Author: TOGtravellerEngland
Reviews.Content: Don't let the fact that this hotel does not have a view of the bay put you off. It is in a great location - very convenient for the waterfront, shopping areas, Clarke Quay and Raffles. The rooms are clean and functional and represent good value for money. Service is efficient and the choice at breakfast is good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stephanielowhh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nites. Clean rooms with funtional old fittings and furniture and very basic hotel amenities. Would say its a 3-4 star hotel at most. Great location at the art & museum district, 2mins walk to the Bras Basah MRT station and it's near a 7eleven and the 24 hours Kopitiam foodcourt. For the price of hotels in Singapore, the hotel is good value for money. The downside is that this part of Bencoolen is currently closed to traffic etc for 3 years due to the expansion of an underground MRT line. The hotel is in the middle of a construction site with a small walkway from the entrance leading out to the main road. You could also hear construction works going on throughout the nite.

Reviews.Title: “Staff need to improve their knowledge”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Mallie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in December 2011. The surrounding area is currently having roadwork done so it was a bit difficult for our taxi driver to find the entrance late at night. The roadwork wasn't a problem as it only occurred during the day. The room was adequate and the bed was very comfortable. The room had a queen size bed and a bath over a shower. It did not have an alarm clock which I think is a hotel room basic and a necessity. It also had a weird space aged type study chair that squeaked if you moved on it. The bathroom had mold on the ceiling and in corners of the shower tiles. This really puts me off. The 3 times we asked staff for assistance and they couldn't really understand what we needed and twice we told them not to worry and figured it out alone. Breakfast was ok with a range of offerings. The location is very good located very close to the MRT. There is a 7 eleven next door and a tea leaf and coffee bean store that has free wifi around the corner. We love Singapore and will come back but next time we will stay at our first choice, hotel Ibis on Bencoolen.

Reviews.Title: “mold in the A.C.?”
Reviews.Content: Everything looked fine when I checked in. However, within an hour my nasal passages were blocked and I thought I was coming down with a cold. Went out, the "cold" went away. Came back to the room, within an hour I was so stuffy that I had to breathe through my mouth, lymph nodes began to swell painfully and I had trouble swallowing. Check out and into the Carleton. The "cold" went away. I have never had such a reaction before, though I have heard about them and am blaming the AC without further evidence. The windows cannot be opened. I couldn't breathe in that room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Clean modern theme rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ksalcalde
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days and 3 nights with my wife and 2 young kids. Experience was good having booked junior suite. I liked the interiors as I prefer the minimalist type. Junior suite has a receiving room with LCD. Location was excellent as MRT Bras Basah station is a stone's throw away. Breakfast is a lot better than grand central hotel. Buffet style. Continental with a few Asian choices. Kids enjoyed the roofdeck swimming pool. Water was clean. I was still able to get good wifi signal even though our room is situated in the 12th floor. Take note there is really no wifi service. Only LAN connection. However Singapore has an abundant supply of wifi networks and some don't require passwords. I'll definitely come back to this hotel on my next Singapore trip. Quite expensive though for a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Major Construction Site in front of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Rottweiler
Reviews.Content: Had to stay one night here as the other hotels in Singapore were booked out for the week. Was shocked to see the entire Bencoolen street is a construction site due to the expansion of the MRT underground system. Taxi's can reach the front of the hotel but need to take an alternative route to get to the hotel front but there aren't regular taxi's now unlike before. You need to walk out to the main road if you need to get a taxi and the hotel staff are not very helpful in this regard. Hotel is fine. No problems with the room doors (don't understand why Indian tourist don't lock their room doors if they are so afraid of people opening the room door. Never had a problem thus far with the hotel staff opening room doors without ringing the door bell first or knocking) and no problems with the buffet breakfast which is simple and predictable but fine. You get the same standards at other similar hotels. This is a 3 star hotel and not a 5 star hotel some indian tourist seem to keep expecting this hotel to be. If they want indian food, stay at a hotel in Little India.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: katbrad26
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Bayview in the past three years and both times I have found it to offer great value for money in a city of expensive hotels. The room was not huge but was adequate size. Mini bar was expensive, but that did not matter as there was a 7-11 right next door to buy your own beverages. The rooftop pool is a bonus and a great place to cool off on those hot afternoons. The bed was very comfortable but the pillows were a bit flat. There was free internet and plenty of channels on the TV. The cleaning lady was very friendly and the room service food was good. Breakfast was included and was buffet-style, with a good variety of western dishes and a few Asian choices - we ate here every morning. The location was great, just a short stroll from Bras Basah and Dhoby Ghaut MRT stations, and an easy walk to Orchard Road and other attractions. Be aware that there are currently roadworks happening around the area on a new MRT station and as such Bencoolen Street is actually closed to traffic, although taxis are able to get access to the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: pawan kumar g
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good. As we wanted a connecting room for our teenager children, we were given that. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped us in arranging transport as we had to go to Kualalumpur. Breakfast was ok though same for both the days. One more thing I want to share that we forgot our bag in hotel lobby and next day we got it back. Beds were really comfortable, bathrooms were clean and rooms were spacious. We had a comfortable stay there.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: zzzuni
Reviews.Content: for its location alone, i would give props to this hotel. i love that it's in Bras Basah because it's not as chaotic as Orchard Rd. yet it's also near the city's attractions. also, it's a stone's throw away from Kopitiam, a food court with a great selection of food. there are also churches nearby. as mentioned in the other reviews, it's a mid-range hotel. Bayview is not as expensive as the other hotels in Singapore. while there's nothing spectacular about it, it's a good value for money since the rooms are clean and big. buffet breakfast had a wide selection. staff was generally friendly & accommodating. ok, it is old but not run-down. overall, i had a pleasant stay in this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the middle range”
Reviews.Author: TTDao
Reviews.Content: Everyone know that accomodation in Singapore are expensive. If you're looking for a clean room right in City Centre at a moderate rate, Bayview is your best choice. Location is its main advantage. At less than 1 minute walk to 3 bus stations and Bras Basah MRT, I think it's the most convenient place to stay. Though it's an old hotel, it's well maintained. Everything was clean and efficient. Front desk and restaurant staffs were kind and helpful. My room was not large, with a glass window opening right on the white wall of the next door house, no view at all, but it didn't bother me much. Breakfast was not bad, not so good either, the food was displayed without care, dishes and bowls are all wet and look disgusting. I was particularly shocked by the noise a lady staff made when collecting and arranging dirty dishes right in the dining hall, and I was more impressed that her manager didn't give her any sign to stop the noise, at least she could do it in the kitchen or elsewhere and not right there when all the customers were enjoying breakfast. One more thing, the street was blocked for construction, it's noisy during daytime.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip for a week”
Reviews.Author: AmritVS
Reviews.Content: To be frank and honest, i booked this hotel based on reviews on various sites. Since i dint find any adverse review of the hotel i thought of giving it a try. i was travelling with my small kids and parents so booked my week holiday as 4 Nights and 3 nights incase i dont like i can switch over to some other hotel. But, as soon as we arrived the check-in formalities were all set and promptly done by the hotel staff (swift). They gave us joined two rooms with baby cot as requested which is a fun comfort if you are travelling as a family. Location is unmatched as it is walking distance from Brash Basah & Dhoby Ghaut MRT stations. . . Although there are not many indulging activities to do at the hotel including a good restaurant, it offers a comfortable and clean sleep once ure back from city activities. The price offered including breakfast is a steal buy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 star on Bencoolen Ave”
Reviews.Author: Traveler5548
Reviews.Content: I will start out by saying we got here because we arrived back in Singapore without reservations and upon arriving at Ibis on Bencoolen found they were booked. The front desk was kind enough to get us rooms here (a block down the street) at a comparable hotel to Ibis - and at a lower price (they offerred a last minute special [$702USD for 4 nights] and at 8 o'clock, we were very last minute. City Bayview is ALMOST as good as Ibis Bencoolen but close enough that I think price will come into play. Laundy (only one machine) is not as good as Ibis - if you have a lot of clothes pick Ibis. Restaurant buffet not as good but still good. I would pay slightly more for Ibis, but you will not go wrong picking this hotel in the mid-price range

Reviews.Title: “Lacking respect, standards, but good location.”
Reviews.Author: Pradonism
Reviews.Content: I was booked for this hotel by our office secretary. We were there in a group of 5 for 3 rooms. Location is great since it is near Bras Basar MRT station and easy access to Suntec Convention center where the Spikes Asia festival was held. Being a Thai citizen, we are used to the HIGHEST standard of hospitality available anywhere in the world. For the price of 190 SGD per night for a 3 star hotel, it was appalling. For that price, you can probably stay at a 5 star hotel downtown BKK. Rooms were ordinary. The TV turned on by itself every morning. (I thought my colleague turned it on, vice versa). We couldn't get any sleep. Pillows were low and needed two to stop our necks from breaking. For breakfast, I really have no idea where to start. Choices were limited. Everything was BASIC. Quality was extremely low. No cheese. Bacon was soggy. 3 choices of salad to choose from and their dressing looked like it came out from a bottle. Last but definitely not least. Where did they hire these people from? The receptionist (male with glasses) probably in his 20s was downright rude. He was pushy and impolite. Repeatedly asked us for the LAN cable (when it was already returned). Only when he realized he looked embarrassed. He needs a harsh lesson in hospitality. Though it was company expenses, none of us were impressed. Would have loved to stay at the Ibis which was a few steps away. They said on their corporate website that free WIFI was available only to find out that it was available only on the ground floor. You need a LAN cable upstairs. If you're looking to stay in a 3 star hotel, please avoid this horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really good standard for 3*”
Reviews.Author: PuffleIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a good honest 3* hotel which punches somewhat, but not significantly, above its weight. If you get a good deal it's well worth considering this ahead of some of the more expensive 4* hotels around the Orchard Road area. It's relatively small; service is good, the breakfast buffet acceptable for the price paid (but they should do something about their choice of breads and pastries, which most days was pretty disappointing - consisting of sliced white bread and not-so-fresh croissants if one was lucky). Great location in between two MRT stations. Their "family room" was a very positive surprise, really large - actually two rooms that could be completely closed off from each other, both with flat screen TVs. Oh, it's clean too, and room service is better than I had in some of the 4*s around the place! So yes, it's worth considering for its value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eva497
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July 2011. Our room was good size, very clean and we had everything we needed for our short stay. The hotel is in great location, only 2 minutes from MRT and about 20 minutes from Orchard Road. There is also free WIFI in the reception area. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No, don't go”
Reviews.Author: SydneysiderOz
Reviews.Content: Booked one night (10 hours stay) while in transit as I was heading to Indonesia resort the next day. Some of the other reviews were saying this hotel was ok - good but I must have gotten an old room.There was NO doubt the room required an refurb. If I had known the rate I paid compared to the type of room I got, I might as well went straight to a 2 star hotel to begin with and not pay that price. Oh, there was blood stain on the bed sheets. Unlikely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but just an average hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Gordon-goa
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable. But the room service is terrible. The hotel staff have a stiff upper lip which is bigger then the famed English! The reception was not too warm and welcoming in the approach towards the guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Trisha03
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bayview for ten nights, very very happy with hotel. Its not a deluxe super duper posh hoel but they accommodated us with a smoking room which was cleaned every day fresh towels daily and bed linen every two days without fail. We had a deluxe room plenty of space, En suite bathroom and plenty of wardrobe space and enough drawer space for the two of us. A safe, fridge ironing board and iron were withn the room. Tea and coffee facilities and fresh toileteries daily. We had breakfast twice which had plenty of choice and is buffet style. Staff very very helpful and friendly. Only one bad night sleep due to noise from outside hotel and a unhappy male somewhere on our floor !! Two minutes from MRT at Bras Basah (nearest MRT station), Tourist pass bought from City Hall MRT ticket office. Fantastic transport system, pass can also be used on buses. About £28 for a three day unlimited use pass which got us to most places without the need for the organised trip scenario. Breakfast with the orangutans at the zoo is a must get there early for a better seat. The food court 2 mins away is excellent value as is the 7 11 store next to it. Will definately be staying at this hotel again. It is in the centre of the city with Raffles and City Hall within a ten minute walk. There is a roof top pool with a washing machine and a dryer t dllars each and washingpowder purchased from housekeeping at a doller. There is no sauna but there is a runniong machine and a bike on the roof if you feel the need. The pool is clean and small but ample.

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: satoyuriko
Reviews.Content: Superior room is of adequate size - clean (though headboard / lamps etc can be dusty), fully equipped (wireless internet access, TV with international channels, tea/coffee making facilities, plenty of toiletries). Service is generally good, especially at reception and restaurant. Location is great - 4 nearby MRT stations (Bras Basah, Dhoby Guat, Bugis, City Hall), museums, 24 hour food court, cinemas, shopping centres etc. It is one of the cheapest hotel among the hotels along Bencoolen Street. Though a small hote but it's fully equipped with gym, swimming pool, bar, restaurant etc.

Reviews.Title: “I' came again”
Reviews.Author: JoseSet_bal
Reviews.Content: Very good rooms, central, excelent swimming pool in the roof. the staff in the reception could be mor friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: Scotrocker
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for one night as a stop over before flying to Australia. The hotel was clean and pleasant enough although the rooms were a little bit basic with some items within the room being faulty. We were only here for one night and as the Singapore Gran Prix was on at the time, we really didn't spend much time in the room. It served it's purpose as a stop over hotel and was a good price, if we were going back for a holiday again I would be more inclined to spend a bit more to get something a bit more central and a bit more luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Nat0123
Reviews.Content: My family checked in for 4 nights late June. This was my second stay here and I find it great value for Singapore. The hotel is not new but if you want very clean and well maintained rooms then this is the hotel for you (or me). Rooms are average size and will comfortably sleep 2 (we booked 3 rooms for 7 people and found it gets cramped with 3 people). We also liked the roof top mini gym and pool area. Breakfast was very average and after our first day we opted to go to the nearby 24 hour food court which was very reasonable and had something for everyone. Location wise it is an excellent choice outside the main Orchard Rd district. Check out the MRT station about 200 meters away...it's very new, modern and takes you everywhere. As this is a new train route for the SMRT, there are relatively few people using it. Only thing missing is no complimentary water in the rooms which is pretty standard everywhere else these days. After forking out $3+ for the mini bar water, we bought bottled water at the 7-11 next door for the rest of the stay. Wifi is free but only available in the lobby. Overall it was a good stay with great service. Staff were able to accommodate our request for late check out to 2pm which was great as our flight was late afternoon!

Reviews.Title: “WORST EVER HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: StefanoLion78
Reviews.Content: They lost my 1-week booking, so we were accepted only for two nights then they suggested to get the luxury room for twice the price! I asked them to look for another hotel for me, and of course they did not do it. The room was very small. The sink in the bathroom always gets clogged and smells horrible. The swimming pool is also ridiculous... so small! The sauna smells of mud. Completely unreliable!!! Do not go there at all! There are hundreds of other hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Bayview”
Reviews.Author: traveltosingapore
Reviews.Content: I and my colleagues were put up in Bayview Singapore last December and it was a pleasant experience. Located on Bencoolen street, Bayview is in the center of the party hub that Singapore is. Clarke Quay, Orchard Road, Singapore Art and National Museum, Suntec City Convention Center, Marina square are all within striking distance of the hotel. If breakfast is your thing then that is an area that needs improvement. Menu is pretty limited and even more so for the vegetarians. A la carte menu is pretty good. nothing extraordinary about taste but the quality standards seemed satisfactory. If you are on business, like we were then getting taxi in the morning is very important. You can either call for the taxi or you can even try your luck by waiting at the entrance. Usually there would be no problem in getting the taxi and you will get one within 15 minutes. The staff was quite friendly and will help you out with most of the stuff that bugs tourists. Room service is timely and the work done is of high standards. We were put up in deluxe room. Television bar and mini bar facilities are provided based on which room is booked. All in all, will recommend it to anyone visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very clean, good location.”
Reviews.Author: vian1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and satisfied with the service. Clean room. Room also has safety box , iron and ironing board. Wi-fi is free but only available in the lobby. I love the 24 hr food court just next to the hotel, cheap but nice food selections. Very near to metro station, bus stop and cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean for short stay”
Reviews.Author: asiatraveller77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in City Bayview at Bencoolen Street for 2 nights. Conveniently located as it's near to the MRT and also food court. Also walking distance to Singapore Management Uni. Location is quite safe as I did walk around alone on the streets at 10pm a nite. But it's Singapore. So it's relatively safe. Rooms are not big but clean and comfortable enough for short stay. And also did not have a hard time in getting a taxi to the airport. There are one or 2 taxis always waiting outside the hotel. Overall, I would rate this hotel as quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: JordanAndJax
Reviews.Content: Just checked out if the Hotel today. Small simple rooms that did the trick-especially as the price of the room is quite cheap! Location was great for us! Right by MRT station, great food options, and Orchard road shopping. Breakfast was great-good food and great selection! Would reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Shoddy for Professionals”
Reviews.Author: Yamamus
Reviews.Content: We had a stay at this hotel arranged by the organization where we had a short-term appointment. In total we stayed almost 3 weeks. The hotel is in a very good location. It's within walking distance to some shops, attractions, and restaurants in the Central Business District north of the Singapore River. The hotel staff at the front desk were polite and professional, and the cleaning staff were also polite and friendly when we saw them in the hallway. The room had a nice little fridge we could use for milk or leftovers, as well as an electric kettle for tea. In other ways, though, it wasn't ideal for a working professional. Like many Asian hotels, the mattress feels like canvas stretched over a bed of bricks. On the last day I finally woke up not feeling sore. They have a small pool and exercise area, which also includes a do-it-yourself laundry facility. They lock the doors for the pool/laundry at 7:00 pm, so that makes it impossible for someone on a business schedule--and yet they charge a huge price to send out laundry. The sheets and towels felt rough and well-used, with some obvious tears and burn holes in some of the sheets and pillow cases. Also, the drain of the shower/tub was almost contstantly backed up, so it was inevitable to shower standing in 4 cm of water.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Lynn919
Reviews.Content: Although in a good position this hotel is not up to the standards one would expect for the price. Staff are not particularly friendly (other that the door staff), only speaking when you speak to them first. Room overlooked aircon units & had a tear in the carpet. The housekeeper seemed surprised that we should object to this! The washing line in the bathroom was too high to use & the loo seat was cracked. There was an offer to move us but we were only there for two nights & couldn't face the upheaval. There is no hotel info (re cost of using telephone, pool rules, TV etc) in the room. The woman on the desk at breakfast on our first morning couldn't be bothered to interupt her chat with a colleague to take our room number & and none of the other waiting staff spoke. Breakfast was just adequate rather than inspiring. Although a nice roof top pool, the furniture is patched and brittle with age. The pool showers hardly produce a dribble. The ladies loo in the lobby had a wet floor & tissue paper on it. The gents loo stank. There was little interest from the reception staff when my husband reported it. As we were checking out two members of staff were having a heated 'discussion' in front of guests. Not a hotel to which I would return!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alansouthampton
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the bayview rooms were big and clean free wifi internet well on the 5th floor, We had B&B and it was a good choice on a morning enjoyed it and it is good for anyone

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place with good service and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Micgwit
Reviews.Content: Bay View hotel Singapore. We booked this hotel as a budget place for our first 2 nights following a long haul flight. The idea was to use the hotel just for resting to help us recover from 3 days of nonstop travelling. We did not expect too much for the price we paid but were very pleasantly surprised. The room was very spacious, especially for Singapore. The pool was excellent with great views over the area. Staff were courteous and helpful. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate for our needs, catering for Eastern, Asian and Western needs. The location is fine, a few minutes’ walk away from local transport or one take a taxi from the rank right outside the front door. This hotel does not advertise itself as a luxury hotel but it is far better than most budget hotels I have stayed at before in Singapore. If you are looking for, good service, larger than average room size, a comfortable night’s sleep with decent food, a pool to relax by; then the Bay view will provide all this. I would definitely stay here again if wanted a few days just to relax and recover from long haul travel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, comfy but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: UspeakNYC
Reviews.Content: Friends and I went on a last minute trip to Singapore for a few days and we selected what seemed like a decent priced hotel on agoda.com. First things first, they adviertised FREE wi-fi. guess what? only the LOBBY had so-called wi-fi. We did not have any connection in our rooms. Truly dissapointing. That's why I chose the hotel - free wi-fi access, a lot of us were traveling internationally and needed wi-fi to access our emails and skype. They did not have wi-fi and the lobby that did was WEAK. Do not book this hotel if you need wi-fi. The food (breakfast included that we paid for) was just dissapointing...I would have been happy with just the basics but they even got that wrong. I'm no stanger to Singaporean-malaysian food so what they served us was really drab and old, like yesterday's food! We arrived early morning, and tried to use our breakfast for that day but they told us no, it is for the next day (the day after your first night's stay). Really? That is just poor management/customer service. They kept saying they were fully booked and yet there were 10 ppl at the breakfast buffett... Rooms were decent sized but both our rooms smelt smoky - like someone was chain smoking next door or in a vent leading to our rooms. It's a no-smoking hotel too. Terrible. Overpriced, and the staff was rude and mean. I will not be coming back. the only plus? the great location (near almost everything, but then again SING is small)

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelcat097
Reviews.Content: We had requested a room in a quiet location away from the lifts but were given a small room next to the lift with a view of a brick wall! Not a good start. We thought we would give it a go but after 2 nights asked to move as it was noisy and depressing and we couldn't spend another 4 nights here. The reception staff were helpful and agreed to move us and we were given a larger room with a view. Unfortunately it also had an interconnecting door and we could hear everything going on in the adjacent room as well as the corridor. Don't pick this hotel if sleep is important as people leave and arrive at all hours and you constantly hear loud voices and slamming doors. Not everything was bad though, the pool was lovely and quiet, we had free wired internet in the room and a decent breakfast included. The location was good, close to the MRT and restaurants. The 24 hour food court down the road was an interesting experience and very popular.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location with all facilities nearby”
Reviews.Author: vipul6789
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel along with one more family of young kids.We had requested for an early check in which was denied by reception staff and our flight landed early morning so we had to stay at a near by hotel for few hours as we had kids.This hotel provides a free buffet break fast and it has got restaurent. Even some of good food joint in singapore are near by.over all a decent hotel only problem is hotel staff are very rigid about rules and regulation and they are not flexible even for kids...

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: matilda48
Reviews.Content: The Bayview hotel has no view of the Bay, it is located within walking distance of Orchard Road and Raffles. Comfortable room nice swimming pool, Ok breakfast helpful staff. This was the cheapest we could find at the time but taxes put the cost up to neraly £90 for the night.

Reviews.Title: “OK but "Bayview" is a bit ironic!”
Reviews.Author: salmoneater
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights on a business trip. It was Ok but basic. Our room window looked straight onto a concrete wall. "Bayview" is a bit ironic! The room was rather small, as was the bathroom, but clean and adequate for a short stopover. Service was good. Breakfast was also good but nothing special. Location is very good - very close to Singapore Art Museum and the National Museum, which really needs a half-day to visit and follow the excellent audio-guided tour of the exhibits laying out the history of Singapore (especially WWII).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: tibetanrangertwo
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my school to Singapore for a conference, and we stayed in this hotel. When we first arrived, I saw the hotel lobby had 80s renovation and was quite small. However, the room was renovated and the toilet was very clean. It looked like I would enjoy my room, but however it was really a mixed bag. First off, the air conditioning was too cold and I often woke up in the middle of the night because I was freezing. I turned off the air conditioning for one night and it was better, but just by sitting in the room without air conditioning proved to be too hot. Another problem with the room is the room is not sound-proof. What I mean is I can hear any noise from neighboring rooms as well as rooms on the next floor. This woke me up twice during my stay at the hotel. It was hard for me to fall asleep again given the beds are not that comfortable. The hotel breakfast was really not that superb. There is little choice in terms of food served and the food was the same every day. However one good thing is the location of the hotel, as there is a local Singaporean canteen a minute's walk from the hotel. The food there, unlike the hotel, has many choices and the food is cheap compared to other restaurants in Singapore. The hotel is also a minute's walk away from the nearest MRT station, which proved very convenient for me as I liked to travel on the MRT to other parts of Singapore. Overall this hotel is great for budget travellers; but for travellers looking for slightly more, stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, service and location”
Reviews.Author: BlackCat2119
Reviews.Content: I can't speak more highly of this hotel, its good location, facilities and most helpful staff. Its location was the main reason for my choice. Situated in the CBD, it is only a few minutes walk in the shade to the nearest train station (Bras Basah MRT) and a short stroll to Orchard Road shops and Raffles City. The facilites are very good. The reasonably large room came with Internet, effective room temperature control, and facilities for coffee making and ironing. Room was dry enough for washings to dry overnight even in the bathroom. Above all, I was most impressed with the helpfulness of the staff. I made a mistake with my Internet booking through Agoda, a third party website, but a staff member (Ms Wan) went out of her way to rectify the error directly with them, quite beyond the call of duty.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: kakaye1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days, wanting to be in the city, and you're perfectly located. Very central. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Bedding was very nice, very comfy, bathroom large and clean. I would absolutely stay here again, for the location, price, and cleanliness. And the roof swimming pool is a deal-closer!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value and I'd go back readily”
Reviews.Author: GB01
Reviews.Content: The Bayview is a good (but not high) quality hotel which I’ve used a couple of times this year. For Singapore, this hotel represents excellent and affordable value. Hotel highlights are; clean but basic rooms, fast in-room internet (you will need to ask at the front desk for an Ethernet cable), a good shower, a smallish roof-top pool, an adequate breakfast (with both Western and Asian food), an in-room safe and very pleasant and helpful staff. The only downside was that the gym located by the pool is too small, the equipment too limited (just one small bike and one treadmill) and the room is far too hot to use. BTW the poster photo of the swimming pool is very misleading - the pool has a cityscape in the background, not an airbrushed blue sky! The Bayview is well situated - on Bencoolen Street, near Fort Canning park - for the city. It’s very close to the MRT metro (Bras Basur station) and the airport takes around 30 minutes in a taxi (S$20 – S$25). An Irish Pub has just opened around the corner and there’s a good ‘Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf’ concession in the same block. A ‘7 to eleven’ is also close by and my tip would be to buy an international phone calling card (S$10) there to use back in the room. I’d certainly go back to the Bayview - it's a perfectly adequate hotel for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get - not bad - but they should call a plumber”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelsAsia
Reviews.Content: The room was very large in size but basic in its contents, the wardrobe needed a paint job and there was no clock of any kind in the room. the bathroom was OK - but kind of lacked a "clean" feel. Plus I should have called about the draingage in the sink , the plug was stuck in a closed position with a minute gap to let the water through - when i took it out - let's just say it was not a pleasant smell...- although by the look of the drain in the bathtub - i think that the hotel has a bigger plumbing probelm than just one room. Internet was free and VERY fast - so for those on business this is a plus ! Breakfast is just OK - i would suggest coffee, cereal and a piece of toast - i was not attracted to the mini sausages floating in oil or the bacon (or so they called it). My room faced onto bencoolen street - and it was quite noisy with the buses going past . At the end of the day if you are looking for a place to sleep - not too expensive and in a good location - then bayview it could be.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathmd
Reviews.Content: The Bayview Hotel is in a great location. The hotel is very neat and clean. My husband and I changed rooms as the bed was not a true Queen or King but a double size bed, we are very tall people so we opted to swap to king singles which we did not mind. My sister and husband had a family room which was a king size bed and a roll-a-way. The room was basic but comfortable and clean and enough room. The bathroom was very clean and modern in design. Staff were very friendly and couldnt do enough for you. Breakfast was very good and enough choices. If you have a flight after check out time, reception will tag your bag and look after it and also give you a towel and let you use the hot shower/bathroom facilities near the pool. There are good eating places all around, close to shopping, and always a taxi outside. Very Good value as Singapore is very expensive. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Attentive Service”
Reviews.Author: Yap88
Reviews.Content: Compared to the other 2 Bayview Hotels in Penang, Bayview Singapore is best in cleaniness and their Service staff were most helpful; always walk the extra mile to help in providing pre-arrival advice, directions and information on public transport matters. Matching this hotel to others of similar price range that I stayed before, they beat others in cleaniness & guest service. Hotel centrally located with easy access to Mass Rail Transport lines. In the locality of great food outlets and restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MissBrisbane
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the pool area is a nice place to hang out and there is a 24hr 7/11 and a food court right beside the hotel, also the housekeeping lady was really lovely. Downside, We had a room right at the lift and the noise was horrendous! Some nights I couldn't get to sleep till 2 or 3am. The pillows were lumpy and we've gave breakfast a miss most days as it was fairly poor, but ook if you're just looking for some coffee and toast. The rooms were very basic and the walls needed to be scrubbed down. Overall I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but could do with renovation.”
Reviews.Author: mm_travel8
Reviews.Content: Had a fairly good stay at Bayview. The location is fantastic, walking distance to Albert Sq, Sim Lim and Dhoby Ghaut with buses out the front too. For those who want to walk, Orchard Rd is only abt 15mins walk away. However, the hotel does look a bit tired and old now. The fitness centre is not great and the hotel in general can do with some renovation. However, if you're not in the hotel much and want a convenient location, Bayview is a great spot for it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: shantichop
Reviews.Content: Decent and affordable accommodation, reasonable walking distance to orchard road or marina square.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, but great location”
Reviews.Author: edace
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the City Bayview Hotel for four nights. I booked a room with a queen size bed, however, on our first night at the hotel we were checked into a room with two singles beds! The hotel staff explained that the only room available with a queen size bed was on a smoking level (we are both non smokers, so this did not appeal to us) and we would have to wait for another guest check out until we could have a room with a queen size bed! As you can imgaine, I was quite annoyed and disappointed by this, being that we requested and paid for a room with a queen size bed. Anyway, the following day, a guest obvioulsy checked out and we changed rooms that had a queen sized bed! The room was comfortable and clean, but basic. The breakfast was also very simple - nothing to rave about. The buffet breakfast comprised of a selection of scrambled eggs and fried eggs with baked beans and chicken sausage, noodle soup, or ceral (coco pops or corn flakes). Although we were disappointed with the hotel, the location was fanastic. We were within walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive for what it was”
Reviews.Author: kiwi024
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and got the room right by the lift which never stopped and was very loud. If we were staying any longer would have asked to be shifted. Rooms ok nothing fancy, Breakfast the same ok nothing brilliant. Location ok and can walk to Bugis and Orchard Road but my preference is around Chinatown and the Quays. Would not stay there again as I dont think it was value for the money we paid

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: mags56
Reviews.Content: I am actually typing this from my room at the Bayview so the poster who said there was no internet access is mistaken. I agree with the postings here - location is fantastic. Staff are friendly but my safe hassn't worked since I've been here - maintenace seems to be an issue. Room very clean - TV basic channels and a bad picture. I'm at the back on the 11th Floor. Noise from, I think air con on the roof of neighbouring hotel but not excessive. Breakfast varied but nothing to write home about. Roof top pool isn't as great as it sounds. On the whole hotel not luxurious but a great central base.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunshineCoastJag
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights in a large comfortable, well equiped room. Room was fully serviced every day. Location cannot be beaten. Breakfast was great - lots to choose from. Pool was lovely, clean and inviting. Also gym and sauna near the pool. Staff very friendly and allowed us to spend the day (after the midday checkout) at the hotel and use the pool etc and have a shower before we left for the airport that night. Staff also gave lots of advice about transport etc. and spoke good english. Concierge and porter were excellent also. Only 1 very minor problem was that the wardrobe door hinge was bent and the door did not shut easily. Housekeeping staff should report it. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly close to Orchard Rd, older type hotel, clean but needs update”
Reviews.Author: vippygeo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one overnight. Standard room large enough, has the necessities, wall paper peeling off walls, bar fridge poorly stocked. Needs some renovation. I found it expensive compared to European hotels. No internet facility. Breakfast buffet quite good. Staff friendly and helpful. I did not compare price with other Singapore hotels and if comparable, I would stay there again for a short overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for travellers”
Reviews.Author: rachel1978
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not memorable but don't take that the wrong way. It is clean, functional, food is acceptable, staff were plesant and best of all it's within walking distance of most places. Singapore accomodation is expensive and this is reasonably priced for what you get (I think). We didn't eat dinner here but there are so many great places to eat near by, why bother, breakfast was fine and food was a mix of asian and western. I'd recommend this to people who don't want a beautiful room to lounge about in, it;s fine but it's not luxurious, also we took the room upgrade to a superior I think, I wouldn't bother, the rooms are a small amount larger and higher up the building, but the size difference is minimal and there is no view really worth talking about. The pool is small but quite nice, the gym is not a gym but a running machine (it's seen better days) and a bike which didn't work. All in all it was pretty good and did us fine for 5 days but we are quite active people and were not in the rooms too much. Staff were friendly and efficient. A good hotel for travellers who dont' want to rough it too much!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: onedaylikethis
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay here with friends/work colleagues on a shopping trip. I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel, as it's been many years since I stayed in Singapore and things have improved in the mid-range hotel market! The room was very clean and tidy, the bathroom was a much higher quality than expected with a large shower and great water pressure. My only criticism is that the room at times smelled quite strongly of cigarette smoke, which seemed to be coming through the air-conditioning vents. Breakfast was included, I was impressed by the variety of asian and western foods. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location couldn't really have been better. The pool was small, but very clean and the one afternoon that we spent up there we had the place to ourselves for most of the time. The 7-11 downstairs is very convenient, and most of our meals were eaten at the foodcourt a few doors down which has a fantastic array of local food at very cheap prices, $3 to $4 SGD for a meal and $5 SGD for a large tiger beer. There is also a lovely coffee shop along Bencoolen Rd adjoining the end of the Art School which makes close to the best Cappuccino I've ever had. I would stay here again, but next time would shop around for a better rate, I don't think the hotel is worth what we ended up paying through asiarooms, also with them the advertised rate doesn't include GST or Service charge, so we were slugged an extra 17% on top of the room rates at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money & well located - 3 star in Singapore is 4 star in Australia”
Reviews.Author: VespaGirl65
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the net and after reading the positive Trip Advisor comments, booked our 6 night stay via email. All communication with them was prompt and they delivered on their promises. I requested, and got , two interconnecting delux rooms for oursleves and our two teenage boys. Our room had a king size bed, adequate storage space, a mini bar, fridge and tea and coffee making facilities and a bath. The twin bed room was the same but the bathroom was a little smaller witht a shower and no bath. We overestimated how little time it would take us to get through customs and into the city via taxi ($22SD inc. luggage), so after travelling overnight on Jetstar (not recommended) and getting in at 5am, we ended up in the hotel at 6am. The room was not ready naturally, but we were offered shower facilities, luggage storage and directions on where we could breakfast next door, while we slept by the pool and rested for a few hours. The rooms had good quality linen and definitiely no bedbugs! The staff were always courteous. Breakfast was fine - the usual western line including a toaster machine (wholemeal, white bread), watermelon and pineapple pieces, 4 juices, scrambled eggs, fried eggs (that were more poached than nastily fried), bacon, baked beans, hash browns and pancakes. Croissants and breakfast rolls were also available. They also cater for the traditional Japanense, Chinese and Malay breakfast as well. There is a 7/11 next door and a wondeful up-market (yet incredibly inexpensive) food hall where all the locals eat adjacent to the 7/11 called Kofitam. Deli france and a coffee shop are nearby too. Unfortunately for us, the new yellow. circle line MRT openned two days after we left as it was just around the corner 200m from our hotel. The only 2 criticisms we had were that the swimming pool on the roof closes at 7:30pm and that the bed was a bit hard but we both slept well regardless. I was surprised at the quality of this hotel as it was listed as a 3 star in the travel brochures but the same style of hotel in Australia would be 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Better spend an extra $30 and get decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tassie74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and was very disappointed with the hotel. Location was excellent being near Orchard Street but that's the only positive thing i can say. The room was disgusting and smelt. It was dirty, especially the carpet. This was not a cheap hotel by any standard but I would have gladly paid an extra $30+ a night to get into something else. Breakfast was average and the facilities were also very average. Will not stay here again to save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location close to Public Transport, Nice rooms, Clean!”
Reviews.Author: TeachingCouple
Reviews.Content: The Good: + Decent-sized rooms, which is why we chose it. We traveled with our baby, who needed some room to run around in a room, as well as have room for a crib. + Clean bathroom, good shower head and water pressure. + Extra pillows in closet. + Lock-box in closet. + FREE Internet access (via LAN cord you can get at front desk) in the rooms. + Mini fridge in room + a/c worked perfectly + black-out curtains helped us sleep late! + TV with cable (only a few channels, though) + Very comfy low-seated lounge chair. The back folded down and you could use it with the ottoman to sleep on. + Great service at the front desk + The included breakfast buffet was VERY nice. Everything from toast to scrambled eggs, to sausages, rice, noodles, fruit, coffee, juice, cereal, etc. + Good location. It was about 3-4 blocks to Bugus Station area, which had lots of shopping, great restaurants, MRT, etc. + We got a late check-out and our luggage was stored by the doorman while we went out and did shopping. (We had a late afternoon flight out of Singapore). This was a GREAT service and much appreciated! The Not-So-Good: + The bed was really hard! I ended up sleeping on the lounge chair, as I have back problems and literally could not sleep in the bed! + Located on a 1-way street, so be aware when taking a taxi and you have to circle around. ++++++++++++++++++++++++++ We would certainly return here! While it was more expensive than we usually pay for a hotel (close to $100USD/night), it was worth it for us. My husband was in Singapore for surgery and I knew we would not want to dance around with questionable hotels, or spend our 5 days in a cubicle-sized room with our 18-month-old daughter. We definitely made the right choice with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a wonderful location and great staff service”
Reviews.Author: jovanpuyo
Reviews.Content: We took the red-eye budget airline flight from Manila to Singapore and arrived to City Bayview Hotel at around 1:00 a.m. The person at the desk was very warm to us despite the late check in. When we told him that we're leaving Sunday night on another red-eye flight, he even offered us a place where we could freshen up before leaving Singapore. Sweet. Room We booked the superior room for US$125 a night all-in. I was expecting this to be small but we were surprised to see that it was almost as big as a standard room at the Holiday Inn. There was a 21" flat screen TV and free wired internet (wireless is only available in the lobby and the restaurant). The bathroom was OK with a tub plus the usual towels and toiletries. The bed was comfortable and my wife and I both had two pillows each. On the downside, the aircon started dripping on day two. We can hear it dripping on the carpet throughout the night. The room smelled like wet carpet by nighttime. It's not a deal breaker for us, but it was a minor inconvenience. Location The location was excellent. It was near every where you want to go and yet the neighborhood isn't as chaotic as a hotel in Orchard Road. Getting around is easy. The Douby Ghaut MRT station is just a 7 to 10-minute walk and there's a taxi stand at the entrance of the hotel. If you're looking for food, there's a 7-eleven convenience store right next door and a Kopi Tiam (coffee shop) at the corner. For Catholics, the Church of the Good Shepherd is just a couple of blocks away on Bras Basah Road. For those who worship gadgets, Sim Lim is about six blocks away. For art and culture needs, the Singapore National Museum is just a stone's throw away. In a nutshell, the hotel's location is just excellent. Staff The warm guy who met us when we checked in was quite refreshing. Check in was fast. As I said, he even offered us an area to freshen up before our red-eye flight on Sunday if we were in the hotel before 7:00 p.m. Other members of the staff were quite courteous with us. They even lent us a weighing scale to make sure that our luggage didn't exceed the maximum weight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Bavroadtrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Bayview on a stopover in Singapore on our way over to Vietnam. Had never been to Singapore so was looking for a good central location, and the Bayview delivered. It seemed to be fairly good value in comparison to other hotels in the area, but a notch or two up from the cheaper Fragrance style hotels. Breakfast was a decent combination of eastern and western styles, but I couldn't bring myself to have beef bacon this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Nilli
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect just near Dhouby ghaut station.Rooms are nice and breakfast very good.over all Good and reasonable place to stay in Singapore .

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: bettyRTW
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with comfortable rooms, good value for a week; I especially liked the small swimming pool on the roof (though not much shade), the self-service laundry on the roof and the free wi-fi in the lobby and restaurant (the room had only free wired internet). the evening buffet is not really suitable for vegetarians, and for breakfast there is limited vegetarian choice, but it was sufficient for me. the location is centric, about a 10 minutes walk to the MRT and some shopping malls. a disappointment was that when I arrived early morning my deluxe room was not ready yet, and when I returned from a walk the room I was allocated to was next to the elevator. the night after I changed to the room next doors but this was a bad idea as the walls are thin and you can hear your neighbours; by hindsight I had prefered the first room. overall, street noise was low as I faced the wall of the house next door. I'd come again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL - GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Navy35
Reviews.Content: The Bayview is located about 10 minutes walk from the start of the main shopping strip on Orchard Rd. Due to the heat and humidity, I would not want to be any further away. If walking is a problem, you do have Dhoby Ghaut MRT close by and there are plenty of taxis also.........and Singapore taxis are relatively cheap. The hotel has 15 floors, and the rooms were neat, clean and quite spacious. They contained a bath and shower, coffee/tea facilities, mini bar, and toiletries. The tariff included breakfast, which is a smorgasboard of hot and cold selections. It is not a huge selection, but nevertheless, there is a good choice. On the top level, there is an outside pool and small gym.

Reviews.Title: “great location,very clean, great”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyAlex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Janary,2010 thru an offer with my friends Great location - around the corner from the center Smallish room but then we were only there to sleep and were generally exhausted after touring about all day. Room very clean , comfy bed. Great full breakfast that allowd us to have light lunches. Very easy check in and out. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a quick Singapore stopover”
Reviews.Author: OzKayKay
Reviews.Content: The location is great, given we only had one day to shop and meet a business associate (5 minute taxi ride to Suntec City and Raffles CIty). Room was what you would expect from a 3-4 star hotel. The price was on the high side, but then again Singapore is getting expensive. Breakfast was buffet, had a nice selection. All in all good for what it was, given other hotels were $A200+, this hotel was well within our price range, in the right location, and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: galesan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what I expected for and I am very thankful with Octopus travel and tripadvisor for this and believe me you're not going to be disappointed.The room itself is clean,nice and soft to look at which is very important to me and it's big enough for the 3 three of us. My parents love's the buffet breakfast , as they always wants to have full breakfast with rice to start with the day. But food is not a problem here in Bencoolen,the area is surrounded with different types of restaurants. I strongly recommend this one for family to travel. My advise to everyone need to book it in advance for I tried to book for 1 night after coming back from Kuala lumpur but the hotel was fully booked though the receptionist were very helpfull and suggested 3 nearby hotel which i want to make a review as well. A bit expensive but it made our stay more relaxing and comfortable especially the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for our prioroties”
Reviews.Author: scallywag22
Reviews.Content: If,as other reports have implied, a budget hotel means no fountains in the hall, no concierge to book expensive concert tickets or doormen to save guests the bother of opening the front door themselves, then, yes, the Bayview is a budget hotel. We have just returned after 9 nights there. Our priorities were central location comfortable beds a pool free internet access All of these were met in the Bayview. We took the package which included a room upgrade [spacious with interesting view], free breakfasts and one free dinner. While not fussy eaters, we found the breakfast lacking in imagination but more importantly, lukewarm at best. This also applied to the evening dinner so we did not take dinner again, as we like our food hot. Northwards to Orchard Rd; Southwards down Raffles Boulevard towards the sea; Eastward to SE Asia and on to Little India and West across Fort Canning Park to Clarke Quay and Chinatown, the central location is perfect. As indicated before, there are only four sunbeds at the pool along with some tables and chairs, but there were never many people there and we were there once every day. To keep in contact with family, the free interenet access in the room was ideal and the king sized bed was wonderfully comfortable.. The reception staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and happy to give advice and information about the area. Steve, the manager,showed real concern that we were happy with everything. Apart from the food [and considering it was included at a price that was no more the similar hotels without breakfast] we could not fault the Bayview at all. We would stay there again without question

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for visiting Singapore”
Reviews.Author: DiegoSydney
Reviews.Content: We came to Singapore as a mix of business and leisure. The hotel was very conveniently located at walking distance to Suntec City and relatively close to the metro station. Apparently a new metro line is being built and a new metro station (not yet operating) is just a few metres away. The rooms were clean and air-conditioned though the bathroom was a bit tired. The swimming pool on the roof (and tiny sports centre) was a welcomed relief from the heat of the streets. We loved having free internet, and the breakfast had a surprising variety of western and Asian food. The staff was very friendly and efficient and they very happily changed our room when we requested to change it because it was too close to the lift.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel in a strategic location in downtown Singapore”
Reviews.Author: The_Rottweiler
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the Bay View in 2009 and the rooms are not only clean but newly renovated. Only complaint was whenever the aircond was off in the room and we came back, the was a strong ciggarette stench I suspect from the blower so someone probably smoked in one of the non smoking rooms. Otherwise staff are very pleasant and helpful. Room rates are reasonable and Orchard road is a short 10-15 minute walk to the MRT station at Dhoby Ghaunt. Lots of food outlets beside the hotel so you have a lot of choices when it comes to local dishes at reasonable prices other than hotel food. No problems with Taxi's as they are available 24/7 on the street. A strategic hotel on bencoolen street and well worth the its value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good VFM”
Reviews.Author: Samunder
Reviews.Content: It is a very good budget hotel. Sittuated in prime location closer to business area. Hotel staff is very helpful and accomodating. A good value for money

Reviews.Title: “No problems!”
Reviews.Author: Arilh
Reviews.Content: The reviews for the Bayview make interesting reading. The vast majority are complimentary but interspersed are some that suggest the hotel is not up to standard. I fall firmly into the first category; I didn't expect the Shangri-La for the price I paid and the hotel exceeded my expectation on most counts. It's central and convenient for both the shopping malls and the tourist areas; there's a taxi-rank outside the front door (good for the airport) and a hawker bar within 50 yards for excellent value food. The staff were courteous and helpful; the room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast menu was varied and perfectly acceptable. It was a good choice and I'd certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Oxys
Reviews.Content: Good location. Kind and efficient reception. Free Internet in the room. The food is ok. The swimming pool on the roof very good. I paid 155 SGD per night, which is a good value for money. I checked out at 10am, leaving the luggage there and went for a city tour. When I came back at 4pm they told me I could relax at the swimming pool while waiting to go to the airport (my taxi was at 8pm!), and offered me a couple of towels. This was very appreciable!

Reviews.Title: “Average three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roamingx
Reviews.Content: Better options in Singapore unless it's high season. This place is a firm three stars, with cheapish and not very tasteful furnishings. Bit dodgy. Staff not very friendly or helpful. I stayed here because having stayed at most hotels in Singapore over the years I thought have been missing something special but I was wrong. One night and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: whatcouldtopthis
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the City Bayview at 4.30am (had previously notified them of my late arrival), the reception speedily checked me in so I could get to sleep as soon as poss. Location was great for me, just easy walks to Orchard Road shops, cinemas, Raffles etc and free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have wished for a better hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Lotty79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the City Bay View with my 16 year old nephew for 5 days on our way to Australia. The hotel was in a good safe location for us to wander around and explore Singapore from (even at night), some tourist attractions were so close we reached them on foot and it wasn't too far to walk to the nearest SMRT station to explore further afield (Chinatown and Little India etc...) There was also a number of good shopping centres near by, which are always handy for food too. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff were very friendly, I'd stay here agian without a doubt. (If you wanted to be picky the roof top pool is a bit small, but honestly it really is a good hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Choosing a hotel in Singapore is never easy”
Reviews.Author: NLR
Reviews.Content: We were staying over in Singapore for 3 nights between NZ & Thailand/UK, just as we had between India and Australia three months earlier. On the way out we stayed in the Landmark (for much the same place as the Bayview) which is near the 'Arab quarter'. Though the room was a good standard hotel room and though it was close to the underground it really didn't have much to offer. We considered 4 hotels this time around the same price, in the end going for the Bayview even though it was the only 3* of the 4 (others were 4*) because of its location on Bencoolen Street near Orchard Rd. Internet booking agencies were considered, but the hotel was offering a good internet deal - which involved upgrade to a better room, free breakfasts and one free dinner for about the same as internet booking agencies. And there was free hi-speed internet Was it worth it? Well it was in a very good position with a small but pleasant food centre next door. The room at first seemed 3* depressing but actually it was pleasant in the daylight and clearly the bathroom fixtures had been modernised. The breakfasts were a little limited but then they were free, and they did have some pleasant Chinese food alongside greasy western. And given other hotels for the same money didn't include this - it was good. The free evening meal was a joke - there was nobody in the restaurant (This is Singapore, food capital of the world!!) - and the food on the buffet was very sad, suicidal even. But the internet was good. So overall it wasn't a bad choice - not perfect but for what we wanted ok. But Singapore hotels are bloody expensive; nearly as bad as my homeland, the UK

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, but it's a budget hotel to be sure”
Reviews.Author: jaizee
Reviews.Content: Singapore seems to be a pretty expensive city for hotels. We booked this place for around $90 USD, which is a good price for Singapore, except this place was really not high end. Breakfasts were the worst I had in all of SE Asia. The first room we were put in had a bunch of tiny little bugs in the bathroom. When we complained the hotel switched us to another room but acted like it was much ado about nothing. I would compare the room to an Ibis-style, bare-bones room, but on the slightly older side. The only positive aspect was that the location was good - a 5 minute walk to the nearest train station, and easy walking distance to the central stuff.

Reviews.Title: “comfort in good value”
Reviews.Author: zen012
Reviews.Content: stay here for a weekend getaway. overall i love the hotel. the front desk was fast and friendly. the room is nice and cozy, complete amenities. but i suggest you bring your own toiletries if you're staying more than a night. or just buy from the 24hr convenience store next to the hotel. the aircond control is a bit tricky though. the food is delicious. i had my dinner for free since it was included in a package. the staff is helpful and friendly. but what i love the most is the location. its not too near the busy life in singapore, yet just minutes walk from them. its not a 5 star hotel, but worth its value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celeblung
Reviews.Content: Good price, nice rooms, good breakfast and excellent free internet connection. The have a small but nice swimming pool on the top. You can make your own laundry in a coin washing machine and dryer. Excellent free internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good hotel”
