Reviews.Author: tunsttravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights, fantastic location for getting anywhere, MRT about 5 min walk and taxis always waiting just outside. Basic but very clean room with everything you need, as we were going to be out most of the time, this was perfect. Everything was spotlessly clean and the staff were very helpful at all times. The rooftop pool was also clean and a nice place to relax in the heat of the sun. Very similar to a Travelodge or Premier Inn in the UK, would recommend if you are there for a few days and need a base in a good central location at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJA_9
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked this hotel for two days as the rooms were not available in the Summer View Hotel where I moved after two days stay. I have found this hotel comfortable, with cooperative staff and excellent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bayview, Loved Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mackie14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bayview Hotel from the 27th Dec 2008 - 3rd January 2009. We got an excellent price for this Hotel so did not really know what to expect - It is more than adaquate for a Sight Seeing Holiday. All of the staff were very helpful, always smiling and could not do enough for you. The Hotel was clean, and the size of the room was very good, free Air Conditioning, a fridge with soft drinks supplied (Chargable) a TV etc etc, everything you would expect - The ONLY problem we encountered was that our room was right opposite the lift and it 'dings' everytime it arrives at the floor - It was very annoying but to be honest we got used to it. I was pleasently surprised with the breakfast buffet, alot of other reviews said it was samey but what do you expect for breakfast, there was Asian cuisine to Ceral and Egg and Bacon, fruit etc - I just had a few different variances every day and it made a good start to the day. The Hotel Location, we thought was fantastic - OK, it is about 5/10 min walk away from an MRT stop, but we actually found we walked to places anyway, nothing is really too far. Orchid Road is just round the corner from the hotel and in the opposite direction you have Raffles Hotel and the Chijmes Centre - About a ten min walk.. The hotel also does have a taxi rank right outside which incidentally were very cheap to go any where. The swimming pool on the roof is 'cute' and very nice, had a nice morning up there in 30 degree heat and sunshine in December !!! :o) Next to the Hotel is a 7/11 store which had most essentials but as you will start to realise Singapore is not cheap in the centre apart from their own cusine. Next to the 7/11 is a Hawker Centre (Food outlet) we thought this was fantastic, 2/3 course meals for around £3.00. If you like trying new dishes then do try the hawker centre's around the city, by far the best way to experience the food - Do not be put off by how food places look in Sngapore, they pride themselves on how food tastes and not the ambience - Hygeine laws (so we have heard) are very very stricked in Singapore. Try the Satays in China Town the were fantstic !!!! Western food is singapore we found expensive, but then the exchange rate was terrible when we went, however it can be expensive but it is very very good !! I could go in to all the sights we saw etc, but discover it for yourselves - everything we done was worth seeing and doing. For our nghts out in Singapore we headed to the Chijmes, Boat Quay, Clark Quay etc all very pretty - Alcohol IS expensive in Singapore so do not be surprised, we were paying £6 - £9 a Beer depending on where you went - Please be aware there is nothing cheap about a Singapore Sling in Raffles, but it is a must - Wonderful afternoon sat in Raffles chcking Monkey Nut shells on the floor :o) Just remember do not drop litter, smoke where there are ash trays and tipping in restaraunts etc is not nessassary - it is not encouraged. All in all we had a wonderful week in Singapore from shopping to site seeing to trying lots of different foods. It is clean, tidy, you can eat your dinner off the floor down in the MRT and people are very friendly - Singapore is a must !! I will just also add - New Year .... We found very little information on New Years eve celebrations before we went, however there are several parties all over but we headed to Marina Bay about 10 - 10.30pm, we had a fab view, the atmosphere was amazing and the Count Down and fireworks were out of this world. If anyone wouldlike anymore info then please E mail me - I cold type all day Singapore and what to do etc. Enjoy x

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: 538Anne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bayview for 3 nights on the way to New Zealand. My Husband, 2 year old son and I shared a triple deluxe room. The room was good and clean, the beds were fine, We had a double and some sort of fold away bed for my son, we all slept well, but the beds are quite firm, so if you like a soft bed this may not be the one for you. The third bed is also suitable for children but not adults. The pool on the roof was great for all of us, not a huge pool but perfectly big enough, again it was clean and nice to use. The staff were all friendly and happy to look after our bags for us until check in time and after check out time. The breakfasts were good but not great. We found that we were close to central amenities, raffles, Orchard Road Shopping and the MRT station. The public transport was very good although taxis are also cheap in Singapore, so we used them when we wanted to. I would definitely recommend a trip to the zoo, my son loved feeding the kangaroos! Overall I would say that this is a good place to stay if it fits your budget, Comfortable and Clean,

Reviews.Title: “Very freindly ssafe hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenniferalisonuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on the way to australia as I had my world belongings with me and didnt quite trust the hostels. It was fairly cheap to stay in and to be honest I got what I payed for. The room was clean... it wasnt the most stunning room in the world and it didnt reflect the pictures online but again it was safe. The staff where really lovely.... they ran after me with the depsit for my safe which i had forgot to pick up on my last morning. The bed was clean, the bathroom was clean.. it just wasnt as modern as some hotels. However... its incredibly central and again I can emphasise how good the staff where. It was pretty much ideal for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore - Nov 2008”
Reviews.Author: ExiledinAberdeen
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days staying at the Bayview. The hotel room was very good, clean and towels a plenty. The restaurant is also to be recommended. Superbly located for all forms of public transport bus/MRT etc. Taxi's are in great supply so not a problem there and cheap. Would recommend for all types of holiday makers from stopovers to families. The pool up on the 15th floor is excellent for having a dip after undertaking a bit of retail therapy or if you have had a tiring day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stopover!”
Reviews.Author: SandraW66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just last week for 3days on our way back from Europe. After reading the reviews we both we were a little reserved on how it was to be. We got to our hotel at about 8am knowing our room would probably not ready and checked in our luggage and set off for to see the sites of Singapore, fate didnt bring us back till nearly 5pm as we found Tour East and booked a 1/2 day tour. We were pretty exhausted on our return and checked in - we were really happy with the staff - very friendly, all I can say is if you are friendly to them straight up they are likewise, and we found them polite, always smiling and happy to see us. The room was great - room 713. Quiet not noisy. although we only had a view of a wall it shielded a lot of noise and views of other skyrises we didnt miss - we went up to the pool for that. Pool was quiet and most of the time it was just us in for a dip to cool down at the end of the day as it was only 1.2mt. We had dinner the first night there in the hotel, but would advise skipping it as if you like asian there is a food hall called the Kopitain next to the 7eleven which is great value, and food is worthwhile a meal can cost from $3-7 singapore dollars. Breakfast is a buffet and is adequate, cant complain. Yes sugar cereals maybe but there is enough other variety to fill you up till after lunch if so be Orchard road, Little India, Raffles and Fort Canning Park (which takes you to Clarke Quay) are walking distance. Taxi's are cheap $5 to the city, We used the blue ones, and if you talk to them most will give you a bit of free history about the town and themselves (lol) along the way. My picks are 1/2 day tour, Singarpore Flyer, Fort Canning Park But you have to witness Raffles - Long Bar, Orchard road and maybe the zoo/night safari and generally wear your feet out walking. It cost us $14 to get a cab to the airport - a blue or yellow one which was brilliant at 4.45pm on a Sat Afternoon, go before 5 to escape the surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: nxf83
Reviews.Content: Bayview is a good, basic choice. When I checked in, they gave me a room on the 13th floor, next to the elevator, which another review warned about specifically. The room looked fine, but smelled like urine. I went down to the reception and asked if they could do something about it. They said they could spray something, but that their housekeeping was closed for the day, so I’d have to wait until the next morning. I find it odd that nobody in the hotel has access to air freshener, but whatever. They were polite, just not very imaginative. I asked if they could give me a different room, and they complied. The new room smelled fine, but several of the electrical outlets didn’t work, and some of the lights didn’t work either, just minor annoyances. I was happy about the free internet, and the speed was good. The hotel staff was not particularly polite, but not outright rude either. I found it bizarre that they never acknowledged my presence when coming and going. There was no hello or eye contact or anything, even if nobody else was around. The food in the hotel’s restaurant is disgusting, but there are plenty of excellent and very cheap 24-hour options nearby. Just next door, there’s a Kopitiam, which is like a food court that has all different types of food. I really liked their Hainanese chicken rice, and the teh susu (strong black tea with condensed milk). On the other side of the hotel, there’s another food center with good Vietnamese and Indian food, which are not as readily available at the Kopitiam. Two blocks down on Bencoolen Street, there’s a 24-hour Indian/Arab restaurant. All of these places are open 24 hours and have great food, and there are so many options you’ll never get tired. I think the food nearby was my favorite part of staying here. Overall it’s a decent hotel at a decent price for Singapore. It’s nothing fancy, but it’s very clean and there didn’t seem to be any shady people there. Even at all hours of the night, there are normal people all around the area, and it feels very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Been to better Bayviews”
Reviews.Author: Willkeeptravelling
Reviews.Content: Read the varying reviews about this hotel on different websites and took the plunge. We arrived as 2 couples, wanting 2 bedrooms and double beds and it was after 3.00 pm. Not a difficult request so I thought. No double beds available and cannot move the singles together. The reception banshee started on us, that our booking was made over the web and it is very clear that they do not have to give us double beds. I replied that is fine but that is not my choice and I am very happy to walk across the road the a very nice looking hotel and can I have a refund please. She huffed and puffed and found one double bedroom and said we could not be on the same floor. That was fine. Next had to wait for our room because of cleaning we waited 1 1/2 hours (no drink no apology) remember this was asking for a room with a double bed nothing more. Went to the reception was told we would have to wait another 4 hours. I said I don't think I am waiting any more I am leaving, suddenly a room materialised on the same floor as our family members. ????? The materialised room was lovely facing the street. The air conditioning was so cold I ended up switching it off . There is only very thin covering on the bed. Bathroom excellent good quality shampoos and towels. Breakfast: Don't bother if you eat European food as selection is extremely small. Pre made underdone eggs, toast, poor selection of highly sugared cereal. We ate toast for breakfast. The location is good was able to walk to Raffles and enjoy the walking to Bugis Street and generally walked around the city. This hotel is good if you can avoid reception staff and not eat breakfast and especially avoid the fruit juice (witnessed something). Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: JenReading
Reviews.Content: Like many others my Mum and i stayed here on our way back from Australia. We found the hotel very comfortable and staff very friendly. The hotel is in walking distance to most places, but we did take advantage of the hop on hop bus, which we are glad we did as it was well worth the money. If you like shopping designer style then you will love Singapore. If you get the chance get the bus to Malaysia it works out to be about £1.50 return and takes about an hour on the bus. Remember to take your departure cards aqnd passport with you. Be careful when you get off the bus in Malaysia as you get approached by un official taxi drivers who will charge you 3 times as much ( i got caught out ) Go to the city shopping mall you will pick up some bargains there diesal jeans, leather bags etc and they are the real thing. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MissJackieChan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for 8 days and thought it was great. My room was very spacious, free internet, clean with a roomy contemporary and clean bathroom. Huge flat screen TV too (in the bedroom that is!) The reception staff were excellent and polite and offered suggestions of places to visit etc. Thought that the breakfast offered brilliant choice and being from 7 - 10.30 meant I could sleep in. Continental choice of croissants/breads, fresh fruit, juices etc, cooked western style, asian and others. It is also extremely central and located easily for galleries etc. I would definitely stay again. Only fault I can think of is the 'connecting door' between some rooms, which meant ocassionally I heard the odd bit of chatting from the room next door, but not enough to be a nuisance at all. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “thin walls”
Reviews.Author: martin_austria
Reviews.Content: hotel is principally ok, but walls are much to thin. third night in a row with just limited sleep, thank god, i am leaving tomorrow. finding sleep on a plane seems to be easier!

Reviews.Title: “Bad start - got much better!!”
Reviews.Author: AdrianGFC
Reviews.Content: Bad start - rolled up at 4pm on Valentines Day with our advnaced internet booking from about 5 months ago, at the beginning of a 6 week trip to New Zealand - only to be told that there were no Double Rooms left for us on Valentines night - only twins!! We politely told them that after a long flight from London he could poke it. Thankfully they came up trumps after lots of tapping into their computer - and gave us a free upgrade to a Junior Suite! Now this was fantastic, a proper suite with lounge, 2 toilets, king size bed, 2 flat screen tv's, nice a/c lovely shower. Only minor thing was sink in one bathroom was blocked & took forever to drain off. Location - within walking distance of everything, 10 - 15 mins to Clarke Quay, 10 mins to Rafflles. Plnety of stuff around the hotel & 7/11 next door! Cannot comment on food - never ate there.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints – clean, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: didileavetheovenon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Bayview for 3 nights on our way to Melbourne in February. We had a limited budget and for the money this hotel was fine for us with the added bonus of free wi-fi access (something we have found hard to get at hotels in Australia). It was clean, comfortable, quiet and within easy walking distance to the MRT (Dhoby Ghaut is marginally closer than Bugis). The bathroom was a little shabby but clean and spacious. There was a large selection of breakfasts to suit European or Asian tastes and the hotel is not far from plenty of cafes bars and restaurants. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We didn't make use of the tiny swimming pool or laundry facilities on the top floor but it was nice to know they were there had we needed them. Overall a pleasant stay and we are considering booking there again on our way back through Singapore in July.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: foz72
Reviews.Content: Firstly the good points: The room was big and clean. The location was excellent, easy walkung distance to the nearest MRT which I believe was Dhoby Ghost. The staff were very helpful and were able to give good restaurant reccomendations We stated here twice (first for three days and then 1 day after a trip to KL) and one of the days we had a room with an interconnecting door, this made the noise from the next room quite audible. I would reccomend the hotel as it is cheap for Singapore and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Good and yet disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Scully15
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the City Bayview after discovering that our previous hotel (which was opposite the CB) that we stayed in wanted almost twice the price we had paid in 2006. Feeling slightly trepiditious after reading hundreds of varying reviews online, we decided that we would give it a shot anyway. After all, the majority of the time when we were last in Singapoare, the hotel was used for sleeping in and swimming! We arrived at the C.B. around 1500 hours. Check in was swift and the concierge very helpful with the luggage. We were checked into room 607. If anyone reading this has stayed or is planning to stay in C.B., please ask to be away from rooms that have 07/08 at the end or else you will find yourself opposite the lifts. Good points about the Hotel: Pool was hardly used - a good thing because it is rather small and I like to do laps. If it had been busy, all I could have managed was a small dip. Corridors were clean and lobby was spacious. Location is a huge positive. Bugis Street one way and Orchard Road the other. Dhoby Ghaut was perhaps 5 minutes walk if that. Negative: No safety warnings at the pool. On my first swim, I slipped badly coming out of the shower as the slope slightly. They aren't designed for safety either - no grip-safe tiles at all. Just normal tiles you might find on a kitchen floor. After suggesting that the staff put a warning up, nothing was done by the end of our 10 night stay. Breakfast. Oh, dear Light, what can I say about this? Buffet style which is okay, but very very limited selection. Three types of fruit juice. Apple, orange and pineapple. The orange tasted like strong diluting juice and I couldn't even bring myself to taste the other two. I ended up savouring a few extra hours in bed and then eating at the Kopitiam thirty yards away. Laundry and ironing facilities were disappointing. There were no instructions on how to work the iron. You had to assume that the timer switch that was meant for the light was actually for the iron. It was six dollars (Sing) apiece to use the washer and dryer and yet only three minutes away was a laundretted that charged 10 Sing dollars for collection, laundering and delivery - all on the same day! Good points about the room: Very spacious Huuuuuuuuuuuge bed - well above king/queen size. Air-conditioned and the window opened ever so slightly. Curtains were amazing at keeping the light out. I woke at 1000 hours one morning and thought that it was still the middle of the night. Bathroom was spacious enough. Negative Aspects Walls were PAPER THIN! I was woken at 0600 by some German man's nokia ringing over and over and then the hotel phone calling to wake him. I ended up shouting through 'Answer your bl**dy phone!' We were given an inter-connecting room - obviously one meant for families. On our second night within the hotel, two girls decided that they were going to play 'knock door runaway'. Feeling decidedly angry at having my night disturbed, I knocked on their door and asked them in no uncertain terms to stop knocking. I then spoke to the front desk and they sent three people to our room to investigate. We were informed that our inter-connecting door could not be opened by the adjoining guests as long as ours was 'latched' into place. There was no lock on it and the fact that there was only a knob on one side (the side into each room) was supposed to assuaged my fear of someone sneaking into the room and perhaps raiding our items. Luckily, the girls appeared to only be stopping over for a couple of nights - of which I am glad - their incessant chatter and giggling had me at my wits' end and I am someone that enjoys a laugh far more than the average person. THE CLEANERS HAVE TO CHECK UNDER THE BED! It's all fine having a newly re-furbished hotel, but the bath was so old that it was stained yellow. Before I took a bath myself, I scrubbed it to ensure that it wasn't nicotine or dead skin stuck to the sides. The TV was so-so. Only two English channels - BBC World News (which repeated every 20 mins or so) and HBO, which due to injuries, my partner and I spent a lot of time watching. The lighting could have been more adequately placed and a lot brighter. After three days in the room, the lightbulbs were replaced by dimmer ones and so we had to have every single light on to feel comfortable to read! I would recommend this hotel for people that have a smallish budget and anyone that is looking for a 'stopover' room between travelling destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: pompey1001
Reviews.Content: Dont hesitate to book the Bayview hotel in Singapore, it was a lovely hotel and the breakfast is fine. Rooms clean and comfortable. Reception staff are very helpful The roof top pool is lovely and they have washing facilities next to it. Best place I have every done any laundry. We are going to stop off at Singapore next year and I will book this hotel up again. Taxi and transport are so cheap that yo can get to any attraction. Like all places in Singapore the wine is very expensive. I would take your own at the duty free and remember to take a bottle opener if you are a wine lover. We had the Asian buffet at the hotel prior to leaving in the evening, and it was not very hot. In fact the restaurant was empty , maybe this should have told us something. Breakfast is fine though and there are loads of other eating places locally. We booked the room for an extra night prior to departure, as we had a 11pm flight and we wanted to shower etc. However you can take a shower at the hotel, or you can book a room for $90 up until 6.00pm.

Reviews.Title: “A Major dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Realtravelasia
Reviews.Content: Many decent reviews of this hotel, and for a while I thought I'd gone wrong, cause the hotel I checked into was not up to standards..... Unfortunately, I found that I was at the Bayview in Bencoolen Street. The beds were uncomfortable, rooms was smelly( I tried two), walls between room are paper thin, the TV had 3 english channels, the hotel does not have a laundry service ( although they have an overpriced self service by the swimming pool), there are no facilities to speak of, and frankly, there are a lot of better choices in Singapore at similar price. On the bright side, the location is very good, and they provide free internet, and that's all the positives I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tambalyn
Reviews.Content: I purposely chose a hotel that's not too smack on Orchard Road but still convenient to get to the MTR. Bayview would be about a 10 minute walk to the nearest Dhoby Gaut station....if it's raining (which it did when i was there), it's not much of a comfortable walk. But taxis are readily available around Singapore as well. The room is a little above average. It was clean but a little bit too small. The bathroom was also clean and was okay. I didn't have much of a good view considering that i got a room thats higher than the standard one. I had a full view of walls! :) Breakfast at the hotel was so-so, not many choices although they try to change the choices everyday. But if you really don't want hotel food, you can easily go to the 24-hour kopitiam around the corner. Next to the hotel is also a 7-11 so food won't be much of a problem at night or early morning. If you wanna go electronics shopping, then SimLim centre is just a good 2-3 blocks away, okay for a leisurely stroll but not when coming back if you have loads of shopping already. I guess Singapore is really very small and it seemed everything is very near each other. I could walk about 15-20 minutes from my hotel to LIttle India or Arab district. The hotel staff was nice and helpful. They gave us suggestions for interesting dinners around Singapore and were very thoughtful to ask us how it was the following day. They were also very courteous and was always ready with a smile when you enter the lobby. Bayview is an overall good hotel to stay for Singapore. Taxi is easy to get from the hotel itself and walking around its area is pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: drkc
Reviews.Content: Went to Singapore for a 3-day conference, which was at the Raffles Convention Center. Bayview Hotel was only 3 blocks away, and I saved a bundle in lodging costs vs. staying at Raffles. Easy to get around, and had a great time in the city. Staff was pleasant. Breakfast buffet every morning was good - Not one complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jenniehome2001
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the greeting we received and also happy with room. Any time we had to ask for anything it was dealt with effitionately. Breakfast was interesting and vast. Area was ideal for getting around. A good all round hotel on cost and location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms & good location at a low price”
Reviews.Author: EvertS
Reviews.Content: I just had to go to Singapore for a business trip. As there was a trade fair most hotels have been either fully booked or selling rooms for exorbitant rates. Bayview offered Rooms for a reasonable rate. Our rooms have been spotless clean. Service was friendly and quick. Excellent location. Good buffet breakfast serving western and asian dishes (5 warm dishes), but not too much variety of bread. You should not expect luxury, but if you need a clean room and a hot shower this place is appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: Melnq8
Reviews.Content: I visit Singapore often and have watched hotel prices increase a great deal over the past few years. I've decided to rebel against high hotel prices, and now I search long and hard for better value. And that's exactly what I found at the Bayview Hotel. I booked this hotel for an overnight stay during a 24 hour layover. I got what I felt was a great deal on a last minute booking site - US $117 for a double room and breakfast for two, inclusive of all taxes (which are steep in Singapore). Our room was compact and simple, but spotless, modern, and very comfortable. It was decorated in light woods, had a cotton duvet on the comfortable queen sized bed, flat screen TV, desk, safe and mini bar/fridge. The bathroom had a shower over the tub and the vanity was nicely decorated with red tile and black accents. Good water pressure and nice amenities too. The room looked recently refurbished. I particularly liked the soft lighting, the overlapping blackout curtains and the air conditioning, which kept us plenty cool, just the way we like it. I'd requested a room away from the elevator, so we had a quiet evening and a good sleep before our long international flight. Breakfast wasn't anything to get excited about, but hey, I didn't choose this hotel for its food. The hotel is located a five minute walk to the Dhoby Ghant MRT station. There's a Kopitiam food hall right around the corner, and we had two very good, inexpensive meals there. The staff was friendly and helpful and even lent us an umbrella for the day. We were also able to get a 2 pm checkout without paying an additional fee. I would happily return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: somsoceel
Reviews.Content: Central location only 10 minutes walk from Raffles, Orchard road & MRT train station (Dhoby Ghaut). Poor view from hotel window, but room good basic standard. Shower curtain dirty. Lovely roof top pool with gym, sauna, plus washing machine. Reception staff not very knowledgeable, but friendly. Very cheap food centres on either side of the hotel for purchase of meals. 7/11 shop also nearby. Taxi is about 25 singapore dollar each way from the airport, but train is cheapest by far 1.7 singapore dollars. MRT is currently being extended so new station (Bras Basah) will only be 3 minutes from hotel. Internet is free at the airport so you are able to send email, etc.. on arrival or departure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stop-over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaldeanTripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a colleague as a comfortable stop-over hotel. I was travelling from the UK to Australia and wanted to break my journey. It is located pretty centrally & is within (slow) walking distance from several attractions (Raffles Hotel; shopping areas etc). The staff were welcoming & efficient - they are very used to tired travellers arriving late, I think. The room was very clean and comfortable. It had a great 'wet-room' style shower which I used within minutes of arriving - so relaxing. Within a one minute walk is a great Kopitiam or food hall with a great variety of local cooking. Freshly cooked, very tasty and so inexpensive. Breakfast in the Bayview is basic but tasty and caters for most tastes. There is a very nice pool on the roof, and when I was there I had it virtually to myself. The hotel is also very well-practiced at storing luggage for guests who have to check-out but have a late flight. This was very reassuring and allowed me to see more of the City. I've been back to the Bayview again - with family this time, and the standard is high every time. It's also very well priced. I will always choose this hotel for stop-over stays.

Reviews.Title: “City Bayview - Great Location, Rooms & Service”
Reviews.Author: Libran20
Reviews.Content: Read all the positive reviews (negative reviews were too few) and pushed an online travel site to obtain reservations at City Bayview. Obtained a fabulous deal, inclusive of breakfast and airport pick-up and drop. My 72 yr old Mum and I arrived at the Hotel to be greeted by a smiling Haroon who picked up our bags and escorted us to the Reception. The Reception ladies smiled (they always had a smile on their faces whenever I saw them)listened to my request for a street-facing non-smoking room and in 2 minutes we were in room 905, once again escorted by Haroon. The room and beds were clean and very comfortable. The Coffee/Tea maker was a boon. The view from our room of the street below was good. We could see right upto the street crossing. The breakfast spread was good. We found some dishes empty on day 1 but after I completed the little card placed on all tables and handed it over to the General Manager, the dishes were never again empty the next 5 days of our stay! The "Roti-Prata" was our favourite. The elevator - which seems to be a point of complaint for many - is a Misubishi, Japan elevator with a smooth/swift speed. I asked an elderly gentleman who had a room opposite the elevator if the sound disturbed him and he said no. We bought the SGD23 Hippo Tours tickets and enjoyed 2 wonderful days of sight-seeing at our own pace hopping-on-and-off (and also did loads of shopping). A pick-up/drop-off point was just 2 minutes from the Hotel. The Cathderal, CHIJMES, Raffles, SAM and Orchard Road were all within walking distance. We really enjoyed our meals at the KOPITIAM food court (next door to the hotel!)- our favourite counter was "Roast Duck". The SGD18 set meal for 2 persons was our favourite. For the famous Singapore Chilli/Pepper Crab we turned to the various Hawker Centers. The highlight of our holiday was being able to board the "Singapore Flyer", which opened on March 1. We boarded a 7pm 'flight' which gave me some great daylight panoramic photos on the way up and stupendous evening shots on the way down. We'll definitely return to City Bayview Hotel for our next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: yorkspuds
Reviews.Content: Our room was comfortable, spotlessly clean, reasonably spacious and very quiet. Big shower. Excellent AC. However, the TV did not receive the BBC channel despite the information indicating the contrary and reception staff were unable to tell us why. The small rooftop pool was a real bonus (there is also a small gym and DIY laundry facilities). The staff were friendly and, with the exception of the TV channel issue, most helpful. Breakfast offered a large variety of choices both Asian & Western, but the quality was only just adequate. For example, toasting bread took a long time using an overworked domestic toaster. The fruit juice was of poor quality as was the coffee and when the serving dishes were empty, they remained empty for some time. The hotel was good value, met our expectations & I would recommend it as economical, comfortable & well situated. Booking was done through Skoosh.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: crabtreeSeoul
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be not very popular to taxi drivers. Everytime we want to get to the hotel, we have to show the hotel map to the drivers, but they are still not sure of the location of this hotel. Nothing is near from the hotel, only what I found was seven-eleven right next to the hotel. Rooms are small not a good view, very close to the next building. Staffs are not very helpful, I asked them how to get to a restaurant, but they were chatting themselves but not cared enough. elevator is very old too. Breakfast was not so good, not various collections(as I remember, just some breads & jams..etc) Not very recommendable

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - central location”
Reviews.Author: merseytripper
Reviews.Content: Very pleased that we chose this hotel. Clean, comfortable, excellent facilities. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We booked a deal including breakfast and were not disappointed, there was an excellent choice to suit all nationalities. Hotel is 10 minutes walk from Raffles and Orchard Road, where the nearest underground station is situated. University district not far away. Excellent, cheap food court on corner just past 7-11 shop. Highly recommended. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: dust56
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this 3 star hotel. Excellent location for tourists or those on a stopover in Singapore. Close to lots of attractions. Room was clean and comfortable. Linen was a bit tatty had a good laugh when on the hotel blurb it stated you could purchase towels at reception. Smoking rooms available however even as a smoker not being able to open the window was a bit disappointing. Would stay here again when we return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Badly managed”
Reviews.Author: JewelzSydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel way in advance because of the location and pictures provided. Unfortunately when we got there they told us that they'd over booked and transferred us to another hotel in Chinatown (without even consulting with us first).We were VERY disapointed. Although the hotel that we were transferred to was nice, it was in an inconvenient location for our needs. For future travellers watch out for the same mistake. I couldn't believe they could actually do that to us but they did!

Reviews.Title: “Ok...but...”
Reviews.Author: iamozbok
Reviews.Content: I have to say straight off, it's in an amazing location, so if you go by that it should be alot more$$. BUT... when I checked in, the lady didn't look at me once and she was chuckling to the male colleague, seemingly about me. The lift scared the [--] out of me everytime and when I got into the room, there were tiny pale ants ALL over the cupboard and in the bathroom. And the bathroom smelt like stale p*ss. I tried to clean the benchtops with toilet paper and the dispenser soap that was there. Aside from that, the room was really nice. Pity the walls are so thin. I had a family in the room next to me and the kids screamed all the time and the parents were loud and they all kept trying to open the door that adjoined our room even though though knew I was in there. TV channels very limited but the windows are massive and it's good to look outside. When I left, the lady who checked me out was much nicer but the bellboy guy just took my bag, labelled it, then left it next to his counter while he saw to a more important looking guy. I expected to not find it when I got back. Upon getting back, my bag had been well looked after, but I would've liked to have known that all day. I asked how I get a taxi, or could he call one for me as it was 5pm (ie peak time) and he told me that I could hail one outside as they go past then walked off on me. I waited for nearly an hour on the curb and when I was finally first in line, an English businessman stole my taxi as I was lugging my bag to the boot. The concierge saw me the whole time and did nothing. Luckily another English businessman saw this happen and promptly gave me the taxi he had rung for 20mins beforehand. Having the 7/11 next door was very handy, but I didn't really enjoy my experience. I am a small female who travels alone, so things can get daunting. I've travelled extensively but I have never had so many problems in one place. Oh, and there was this creepy Indian guy that would follow me around the lobby and in the lift. I often saw him sitting on the couch near the brochures watching women. No staff seemed to care.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Room with Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: abhaagarwal
Reviews.Content: We stayed from the 14th of Feb until the 16th of Feb 2008 at the City bayview hotel. I looked at many options on kayak.com and after reading all positive reviews at trip advisor decided to pick the hotel. I know the area really well as I visit Singapore quite often. Nevertheless the hotel looked exactly the way it was shown on the internet with no hanky panky business. Our check in was a 2:00 PM which was a wierd time. The guy at the reception desk said we could come in by 11 AM to check in which seemed a good proposition. When we were about to check in a lady came down (Seemed European) who was extremely annoyed with some water leakage from the ceiling and how her husband would be so annoyed with her for this! We were extremely scared to hear and this and we thought we were in for some major crappy room in such cases. But that was definitely not the case. Our room was right at the end of the corridor and near the house keeping room so in the morning we had some noisy house keeping chinese lady making all sorts of irritating noises. Finally we had to ask her to stop it and she did. I found the bathroom stinking at times maybe because the main bathroom drain was right under us (Atleast I am presuming that). The funny part was before I left for Singapore I had checked with the hotel on the breakfast that was suppose to be included with the room rate. Once we reached there the reception lady haughtily refused the breakfast saying that she never mentioned about the breakfast. Anyhow the seven eleven store right next to the hotel was a boon we had coffee and a butter croissant every morning! Good clean room with a clean bathroom was something I liked about Bayview and yes its sooooo close to the Dhoby Ghat MRT station and very close to Plaza Singapura Mall which is a boon in disguise. Overall for shopper who are looking at more like a sleep and stay place its a great place to be at!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night transit from Thailand. We have stayed in quite a few Hotels in Singapore and I would rate this one as one of the best for value. The check in staff were polite and efficient. There was a LAN Internet access in the room and WIFI in the Lobby. The location is good with a 7-11 next door and a great food hall ( Kopitiam)next to that. We left early so missed the breakfast but would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lollipop21
Reviews.Content: I booked about a month early for this hotel and was very happy with the hotel itself. The staff were very helpful and room service was excellent. It was a very clean and well kept hotel. We did not use any of the facilities but the location of the hotel was excellent for the centre of town and for a night-time jaunt to the Raffles hotel for the singapore sling! Check-in was easy, and even though some had mentioned that the lifts were noisy, we were opposite them and did not hear anything. I would highly recommend this hotel and don't believe that paying more would get you better service or cleaner rooms. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdownunder
Reviews.Content: Bayview Hotel Singapore Had a two night stop over here on my way from Australia to Germany in October 2007. The hotel is a good choice for a short stop over, not sure the room is large enough if you were staying for a week as it is a bit on the small side and the view from my room was just a brick wall which wasn’t really an issue as I wasn’t in the room during the day and made the room feel private at night. Check in was quick and efficient and room 714 was in working order except for one light above the minibar and the shower curtain had a bit of what I am assuming was mould on it. The room had everything you need, comfortable bed, TV, fridge, but only 1 armchair plus another at the desk so if there were two of you in the room only one would get a comfortable chair. The bathroom looks like it has been recently updated and had a fresh modern look to it. Breakfast was included in my rate but was on the disappointing side and below par compared to the rest of the hotel, ok if included in the price but probably not worth paying extra for. The location is great basically at the very bottom of Orchard Road, I found it an easy enough walk up Orchard Roadto Scotts Road and down to the Marina area, Raffles Hotel and the river area. Next door to the hotel is a 7-11 which is handy for basic items and on the corner is a very popular local café that seems to be open 24/7. Nice rooftop pool with a bit of a view over the surrounding area. Also on the top floor they have a washer and dryer which I didn’t use but would assume it is for guests plus changing rooms which you can use after you check out for a shower if you have a late night flight like I did.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: italyItalia
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the city bayview hotel and I found it nice, clean and in a good location. Breakfast was good and with a lot of different choices, the roon was in order and clean. Staff at the hotel is very polite and charming. Surely a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Economy_Class_Clive
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on our way back to the UK from Australia in Jan 2008 and would definitely recommend it. We were given 2 adjoining rooms which was very good as our children are 11 and 12 and it was good for them to be able to get to our room without having to go out into the corridor. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The shower cubicle in the twin room was very big while ours was over the bath. The room top pool is quite small but more than adequate for a refreshing dip. There are also guest laundry facilities up there too which is useful when you've been on the road for 3 weeks as we had. You can swim while you do your laundry. The hotel location is great. There is a 7-11 food shop next door with a food mall next door to that. The nearest MRT station is a ten minute walk away. Orchard Road , Raffles, China town and Little India are all about 20 minutes stroll away. Breakfast was a buffet and was ok, with a variety of foods offering something for most tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Stay”
Reviews.Author: fre0man
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel Dec 21 -26 2007. A friend mentioned this hotel and then i checked the positive reviews on tripadvisor and went ahead and booked it direct with the hotel website. I booked this hotel because of its central location, ie proximity to Dhoby Ghaut MRT, Orchard Road, Raffles Hotel, Funan IT Centre. although did not have time to visit the famous Raffles. Sure enough everything is walking distance. Just make sure u are prepared for walking in the heat..ie. talcum powder for chaffing and worn in shoes. I also concur that nearby 711 and "kopitiam" food hall are extremely convenient for sundries and midnight snacks. I initally received a room opposite an elevator which i was warned from previous reviews not to accept. I then got a much better room fronting Bencoolen St with a much better view near the fire escape and secluded from the elevator. There is a Sauna and pool on the top floor which i only had time to try once. Good if u have time. Breakfast is routine but is a good way to start the day if have to go without lunch. Overall a very practical hotel and good if u can get it when it is not peak season. Try and visit Sentosa, Night Safari (express bus), river cruise from Clarke Quay. [--]

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all”
Reviews.Author: harvblue
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant 2 night stopover in Singapore and would have no problems at all recommending the Bayview. It was good value for money. The rooms were fine. Breakfast ok. There were plenty of eating places nearby, but we liked a place just round the corner called Kobe Tiam (or something like that). It was an oriental food court with all sorts of food, from pizza, to Indian, to Oriental food - all at very cheap prices. Give it a try!. Walk left out of the hotel, and you can't miss it. We used taxis to get around as we were only there for a short while, and they were fairly cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, in May 2007. The location was within walking distance from many attractions such as orchard road and Raffles. Taxi to Sentosa chair lift was around $15. The hotel was clean, and the service was pleasant. The only complaint would be that the walls in the rooms are paper thin, (which is something I would never normally complain about) but we were next to the elevator and you could constantly here the dinging of the bell and people coming and going all night. Additionally, there was a man on the telephone in the room next door and we could hear everything that he was saying. We did not request to change rooms as we were only there for two days. Other than that, the hotel was well located, bed comfortable, and the price was right - only approx $100 aud per night. If I was to stay again, I would probably pay a little extra and stay somewhere more luxurious around the china town area near clarke quay & boat quay. A piece of advice, regarding the Night Zoo, there is a bus that runs from stops around Singapore to the Zoo at certain times for $4 each way. Much cheaper than paying for a tour, and more flexible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: karenbeanpole
Reviews.Content: Only a 3 star hotel and the facilities are nothing to write home about (small lobby area though adequate, almost non-existent gym), but for the location, I would give it 5 star. it is walkable to Orchard Road and almost any direction will take you somewhere on foot. Otherwise, the bus routes are great there and the underground is only 5 mins walk away. For value, this is definitely the hotel to stay in. We were there for a week, no breakfast included, but there was a 24 hr hawker style coffee shop just next door as well as a 7/11 shop. The swimming pool was a good size on the roof top. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Great for budget traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AliJG
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a 3.5 week trip to Australia, and stopped off in Singapore enroute for 3 days. We spent a lot of time researching hotels and where to stay in Singapore and have to say that we were not disappointed in our choice of the Bayview. Our flight arrived at 7am and although check in wasn't until 2pm the hotel reception were very helpful in trying to get us checked in as soon as possible - we were in our room by 11am which was wonderful for 2 very tired travellers. The hotel is on the corner of Bencoolen / Orchard Road and an ideal location for sightseeing. The nearest MRT station is only 10mins walk - and Raffles,Chijmes only 10mins walk the other way. There is a 7-11 right next door and many coffee houses and eating places practically on the doorstep. Our room was clean and comfortable - and the shower amazing. Breakfast was a buffet of a variety of things which was a very nice start to the day. We didn't get chance to use the pool facilities due to our hectic days of sightseeing but given the excellent facilities experienced at the hotel this would be of the same calibre. We will definately stay here again - and we'll definately be going back to Singapore again as it was such a lovely place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bowdenj
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all our needs - its location is perfect for tourists, great breakfast buffet, Steve the manager (?) was great and provided us with tourism information and suggestions, price was also good. We paid around $US122/night for 5 nights at end of October 2007 and had a room with two beds. We were surprised that the price included breakfast every morning. The only complaint is the room we had 910 had a shared door - but the door is very very thin and you can hear EVERYTHING in the room next to you. Luckily we had quiet people next door and weren't disturbed. Hotel is about 2 blocks from National Singapore Museum, Raffles, Singapore Art Museum. Orchard Road is a slight walk but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: HousewifeStavanger
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 who stayed here on stop over to Australia. We were very pleased with the linked family rooms - almost like having our own suite. The hotel was very clean, and quiet. We had a great stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the bell service”
Reviews.Author: Theloo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bayview after trouble with the hotel that we were originally booked in. The hotel reception was welcoming and rooms were clean. The bell service for the hotel was very insisting on having a tip when he assisted us with our luggage from the lift to the room. I was always under the impression that it was discretionary in Singapore particularly in light of the service charge that everyone has to pay irrespective of the service you receive. Breakfast was rather poor with the emphasis of waiting staff on collecting your breakfast voucher rather then waiting on you. Upon our check out the bell service assisted us in getting our luggage from the reception into the taxi. And again the employee was insistent that he had a tip for his limited service. This practice of paying a 10% service charge always troubles me when poor service is given. To add insult to injury it irritates and repels me when members of staff demand to be tipped. It maybe time for the hotel management to look at the practices of certain individuals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, very good location”
Reviews.Author: PADK
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a very long Far East holiday with a stop in Singapore from 20-25th August. Our last visit to Singapore was 7 years ago. Previously, we have stayed at a hotel in Orchard Road then and alI I can remember was going through lots of shops before getting through to our hotel lobby. Arriving at Bayview was a a very pleasant surprise. For a country where city space is premium price, Bayviews hotel offers a nice welcoming atmosphere when you step inside their lobby. The room we were given is of very decent size. We have booked a triple room for our family of 2 adults and 2 kids. We definitley have plenty of room to move about. Oh, we have stayed in some big city hotels before when you only have just enough room for 2 suitcases. The staff are amazingly polite, helpful and friendly, but that is most of Singaporean for you. They all love English football and our 5 year old son wearing his Man U kit was an instant star. Breakfast is served daily unitl 10 am. It's the same every day but then, enough choices to vary your plate each morning. In terms of location - Ideal! Bus stop 5 meters to the left as youstep out of the hotel. Dhoby Gaut MRT about 10 mins walk (with children's pace). There re eating places right outside the hotel to the right and if you turn left, next to the hotel is 7/11 and a massive local fastfood place calle Tokipiam (or something like that). Wow for those like me who loves oriental dishes. Yum! There are several cafe's (name it, and you can walk to it). Funny how we found on the 2nd day that to go to most places of interest like Orcahrd, Raffles hotel, Bugis Street and the Suntec Mall, it is easier to walk because of the one way road system whichmeans some routes will have to do a turn around to take you to the next street. Well, walking was fun, go to see some interesting buildings. When you get to Bras Basah (that chages to Orchard Road as you go right). turn left and 2 streets away is Chijmes. Don't be fooled. It is not a place of worship. walk in and enjoy beautiful gardn setting of several eating and drinking places. Be warned- can be pricey for some budget travellers. Do try the DHL helium balloon- not far from Bugis street. Anyway, enjoy Singapore, it is a very unique, organize, and totally civilized Far east adventure . Cheers, PADK

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lillywr
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had come to the end of our 5 week travelling experience through Asia so were much relieved when we came to the hotel (that had been previously booked) it was clean, comfortable and in a perfect location to explore the city. The staff were courteous and adapted themselves to our every need. The room was always spotlesly clean, however my only complaint would be that the toilet sometimes smelt after stalinisation - but I guess that is inevitable. The shower was huuuuuuuge, and the most powerful I have experienced in a while - maybe because I was putting up with cold hoses as showers!! I would really recommend this hotel to anyone, specifically for location and the fact that breakfast is included - which is always an added bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: goonette
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a good location but was not very clean. The rooms were sparse and the bed uncomfortable. The fridge smelled so bad after opening it I couldn't clear the smell from the room for a good couple of hours. The staff were friendly and helpful which is the only thing that saved me from making a major complaint. If I were you I'd find somewhere else to stay. Not good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: karen11au
Reviews.Content: The Bayview is an average hotel but for half the price I stayed across the road at the Bencoolen a month earlier and it was just as good. The rooms are larger at the Bayview but if you are on a budget choose Bencoolen.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great but stayable”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the internet. It is not easy to find hotel rooms in Singapore especially when there are trade fairs or conferences in the city. Chose this hotel because no other rooms were available elsewhere. Fact #1: Hotels in Singapore aren't that cheap Fact#2: This hotel is one of the cheaper ones, so you can't expect much If you want something cheaper than this, it will be likely those that are often used for "bed activities" If I am travelling on business, I will definitely stay at a better place, but I will not hesitate even for a second to stay here if I have to pay on my own. Close proximity to cheap food. Need a bit of a walk to subway. But can manage. Not that easy to get taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: red_wanderer
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for two nights paying US$130 per night for a double room. Location is excellent for exploring Singapore with an MRT station within walking distance. It's not actually that far to walk to the area where Raffles Hotel is. Room was a good size. Staff are friendly. Bad points: poor cable TV - choice of channels was rubbish. Walls are thin and we could hear the couple next door arguing. Breakfast was not that great - we preferred to eat at the Kompitel food court place down the road. Worst thing was the bedbugs! Other than the bedbugs, I think I would just about recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: carlnoweast
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights. Nice room, comfy ambiance.. helpful staffs.. what i dislike -- you can hear voices from nearby rooms , mostly chinese tv channels, lack of spare electrical outlets for my videocam.. but overall, our stay is good and will recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MK10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and were very happy. We paid about 130S$ per night, which is very reasonable. Hotel staff were effective/friendly/helpful/responsive; the room was very clean; room amenities are good (basic toiletries (toothbrush, shower gel, shower cap, lotion, conditioning shampoo, soap...), instant coffee/tea, free internet access, safety box, etc.). The location is excellent - Seven-Eleven, a foodcourt called "Kopitiam", and coffee shops are just a few steps away. MRT station is just less than 10 mins walk. If you're looking for a place to stay comfortably, not luxuriously, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good base to explore city”
Reviews.Author: millypoppymo
Reviews.Content: this hotel was of good quality and a reasonably good location. The pool area was nice, with a self service laundry area. The room was clean and nice, but quite small. Not sure how this compares to other hotels in Singapore. The staff were helpful and the restuarant was nice. Overall not outstanding but nothing complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: trevostar
Reviews.Content: Surprised after reading all the positive reviews on this website when I arrived at this hotel and found that it looked a bit like a hostel. Was not impressed with the lobby that was small and rather unwelcoming looking. Was even less impressed by the room that was about as nice as my dorm room in college. Bathroom was modern but not very nice. The only toiletry in there was liquid soap that you have to push on the wall to get a squirt, like in the gym. Bedding was hard and uncomfortable, with very thin blanket that had a very cheap feel. Breakfast was quite awful, all the bacon was burnt to a cinder and scrambled egg was soupy. Walls in the room was also very thin as I could hear someone next door coughing every time. The door of the room also didn't close properly when it swings shut. Of course I didn't realise this so the door was unclosed for the whole night. At 5am I woke up becos someone was knocking on my door. When I got to the door that was when I realised it was still open. Imagine how terrified I was discovering that after hearing knocking at 5am! I quickly slammed it closed and looked though the peep hole to see no-one there. But the thought that someone could have just come in while I was asleep creeped me out big time. Worst part of this is that something was maybe going on in Singapore that week so I couldn't book anywhere and ended up paying to pay 170 SGD for this hotel. It is a major rip off for this standard and I imagined that all the other people who wrote positive reviews about this place must have paid a lot less. Basically was told by friends that you should not be paying more than 90 SGD for here. Even at that price I think I would still look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Morningsider
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Singapore at 10:30 and took the airport shuttle to the hotel, it was a 20 minute drive... Was offered early check-in upon arrival...the room was clean and well furnished, the air-conditioning was quite good. The shower pressure was quite impressive, the slight problem with the wash basin was rectified immediately upon notification. Dhobi Ghaut MRT (train station) is a 10 minute walk and can be quite tedious in the sultry weather...All in all, a pleasant stay and a perfect base to explore the city state.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: eos26
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Probably one of the most conveniently located hotels we have ever visited. Short walk to most attractions including art museum, Raffles area, Bugis and even Orchard Road! Just outside the hotel, there is a 7-11 store plus a 24-hour coffee shop selling a wide range of cheap delicious food. The Kopi-O (black coffee) is only 80 cents! You can get a decent meal for under S$5. Although the rooms are a bit small, they are comfortable with most ammenities such as a room safe and coffee/tea. The bathrooms are immaculately clean and quite modern. Hotel facilities include a small roof-top pool with good city views, and free internet - the reception will lend you a LAN cable or you can use the wifi in the lobby. This hotel will suit business travellers and also tourists who spend most of their time sightseeing, as they probably won't mind the compact rooms. Probably difficult to find better value for money in Singapore. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: smartcat64
Reviews.Content: Booked on the strength of reviews on this website and wasn't disappointed. Nice sized room, well appreciated tea & coffee facilities, clean spacious bathroom. Breakfast was more than adequate although more sausage and bacon would have been appreciated but I survived on the egg and beans. TV was a bit hit and miss but enough for the time I spent in the room. Location, excellent for everything - metro close by and all shops, sights in easy reach. Well worth the price though and I will defininitely stay here again if I am in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise, very pleased with the room”
Reviews.Author: Savvy-tourist
Reviews.Content: I just returned form Singapore where I stayed in Bayview hotel. Travel airport-hotel: my travel agent forgot to mention the shuttle bus on the voucher and I had to pay for it. It was 7 S$ one way, (shared with 5 people) in a Mercedes van with no meter. When I got off he offered to take me back for 35 S$ and I rejected. He lowered the price at 25 and when I told him that I will check with a taxi first, he took off. (the taxi for the airport is 15-20 S$ from anywhere in the city). Beware of crooks. I was a bit tense before the arrival to the hotel, taking in account my disastrous experience with Golden Landmark Hotel a couple of years ago. Since my flight arrived at 8 AM in Singapore ( 13 hours of flight ), and I had the next plane at 1 PM next day I booked two nights to be hassle free and to check in immediately. Location: the location is good, almost in the city center, near everything. Lobby modest, one TV screen, only some sofas, no internet. ( you can get internet access in department stores with computers and also in telephone stores, free of charge). The room paid: Superior with breakfast. What I asked at the front desk: High floor, good view, quiet (not near elevator), non smoking, no pets. I was extremely pleased to see that was very clean. Clean indeed, without any smell and I could walk relaxed and safe bare foot on the carpet and in the bathroom ( do you follow me ?). This is the first time after many years in hotels all around the world in this price tag… Bathroom clean, with no mold. Some amenities. Towels worn, but clean. Bed (double) very clean. Whole room refurbished with very good taste in colors and design. A small safe working, hangers. TV, I did not check tough. A minibar but does not worth the money. It is a 7/11 shop next to the hotel full of drinks. Lights: extremely well done, switches everywhere, could modulate light in every corner intelligently. Very pleased. Air con: individual for the room. Working. Could adjust flow and temperature. Very pleased with that. Overall: room very good for the price. View: do not be fouled. The name has nothing to do with the bay. Take a front street room. The building is somehow low and very near the other buildings all-around. The best view is on the main street. Take a higher floor, ( I was at 12) because the traffic is high and noisy. Scary: to my horror, the room was connected the next one by a double door. Each room could open only its door (only interior handle), nevertheless there was no system in place to clearly lock my door from inside. The elevator correct and safe. I was surprised to see an announcement that is available some free laundry on the last floor. ( I did not check tough). Anyway, is good if you stay for a longer holiday. After checking in, I went to take my breakfast. You will get a voucher for that. Breakfast: disappointing. No cheese, no bacon. Scrambled and fried eggs, a processed ham pathetic, one Chinese processed meat can type sausage, some cereals, no milk one type of orange juice, one of coffee, (no decaffeinated), and tea. Some fruits and sweets. For the price, almost nothing. The restaurant clean and refurbished. Conclusion: do not include in room price the breakfast, does not worth the money. Go around the corner, there are plenty of restaurants with great choices. Town: each time I go I relax and enjoy. People are friendly, smiling and relaxed even they are not rich. Can take and understand a joke. Think about Tokyo for example…. In Singapore was an IMF meeting at the time and police was at every corner. They discretely scrutinize you, nevertheless, overall you feel very safe in town. I went to Clarke Quay, took a boat around the bay and after that the lunch. I tried to walk there but is a bit far (2 Km ?) and I was approached by a old may with a rickshaw. I did not negotiate any price. The guy was so old and weak that almost I had to push him since could hardly make any progress. After less that one km he asked me 10 S$ that is 5 times more than the taxi for the same distance. I gave him 3. The restaurants on the Quay were empty. I shopped a bit around and I could see that one can get first beer free with the meal. Do not forget to ask. I took tenderloin that was advertised at 22 S$. I offered him 15, he rejected, we settled at 18 and first beer free. Do not forget to bargain. Returning, I took a taxi and cost 7.5 S$ for 2 Km, that later I felt high since for the airport like 15 Km I paid 15 S$. Dinner: I returned to the hotel and asked them since I leave very early and I do not get the breakfast in the morning to give me a cold snack. There were a bit surprised and after some deliberation they gave me a voucher for the dinner. Only a few persons there. Food was much better that breakfast (buffet also). A few type of meat some sea food even a Japanese dish. It was good enough for me. There was no orange juice and I asked for it, telling them I have no intention to pay for it since should be included. They brought a glass. Promptly. I did not take a coffee at the time and before leaving the hotel I went to take a coffee that they gladly served free. From what I could see ones should not go for meals in the last half hour before closing because food is scarce. Overall impression of the hotel: very good for the price, very clean room, staff friendly and helpful. Restaurant's foods rather poor, do not worth the money. I would go again and I would recommend it for longer holidays too.
